Azir.title: They Have Overstepped
Azir.description: Lane poke and sustained trading pattern.

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Azir is a champion who rapidly casts abilities thanks to his auto-attack nature with [W]. Because of this he is able to repeatedly cast Comets with relatively high hit-rate thanks to the slow on his [Q]
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Azir is a champion who typically doesn't opt for a mana item, rushing Nashor's tooth and Magic Penetration. Manaflow allows you to supplement that loss of mana sustain and continue pumping out damage in the early to imd game.
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Celerity
primary_data.why: Celerity's bonus Movement Speed allows you to better position yourself so that you're able to repeatedly attack with [W] in teamfights.
primary_data.description: Gain 4% extra MS. Gain extra AP or AD, based on your bonus MS, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch provides fantastic early game harass potential so that you're able to keep your enemy laner in kill threat at all times with your jungler.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Cheap Shot
secondary_data.why: Azir is a champion who loves to trade early and often from distance with [W]->[Q], because of this Cheap Shot allows you to take those trades and remain healthy for early game skirmishes around the mid lane.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Zombie Ward
secondary_data.why: Zombie Ward provides all-around excellent and consistent vision control around the mid lane, allowing you to keep better tabs on the enemy jungler.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Lethal Tempo
primary_data.why: Azir loves to auto attack with his soldiers, especially with his most recent changes. With Lethal Tempo you're able to scale into the mid-late game as an incredible hyper carry.
primary_data.description: 1.5s after damaging a champion gain a large amount of attack speed. Lethal Tempo allows you to temporarily exceed the attack speed limit.

primary_data.name: Presence of Mind
primary_data.why: Presence of Mind is a great lane/teamfight mana sustain rune, allowing you to spam, so long as you're taking advantage of it when you level up or get a kill/assist.
primary_data.description: After gaining a level-up or takedown your abilities will have their mana costs refunded for a brief time.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: Doubling down on Attack Speed, Azir scales incredibly well with Legend: Alacrity and auto-attacking with his [W].
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Because Azir often builds a few health items (Rylai's/Liandry's) he is not able to make complete use of Cut Down against carries, so Coup De Grace is your best bet for ending the enemies lives as quickly as possible.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: More CDR means lower [W] cooldown which means more soldier. All of your damage in this loadout focuses on having soldier out to auto as much as possible so you're going to need the CDR.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Gathering Storm
secondary_data.why: Gathering Storm on Azir makes him an incredible late game hyper-carry. A little Magic Penetration from items and Attack Speed from runes and Gathering Storm brings all the extra AP you'll need to carry.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Vladimir.title: The Clot Thickens
Vladimir.description: Summoner Spell spam and mid game power-spike.

primary_data.name: Unsealed Spellbook
primary_data.why: Unsealed Spellbook paired with boots of Lucidity and Cosmic Insight will grant you massive Summoner Cooldown allowing you to spam them for maximum kill potential and safety.
primary_data.description: Get Summoner Shards and exchange them at the shop to change your Summoner Spells during game.

primary_data.name: Perfect Timing
primary_data.why: The stasis from Stopwatch is a must have on Vlad as you're able to heal through it with your ultimate giving you the opportunity to potentially out-play the enemy in a 1v2 gank from the jungler.
primary_data.description: Gain a free stopwatch. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

primary_data.name: Magical Footwear
primary_data.why: Magical Footwear saves you the hassle of having to spend that gold on boots, empowering your mid game for more damage/utility making you a monster.
primary_data.description: You get free boots at 10 min. but you cannot buy boots before then. These boots give additional MS. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.

primary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
primary_data.why: Vladimir can massively abuse the extra bit of Summoner and spell CDR for harassment and lane pressure throughout the entire game.
primary_data.description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Transcendence on Vlad allows you to become an unkillable god in the mid-game, reaching 40% CDR with just Protobelt, Zhonya's, and Boots of Lucidity.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+22 Ability Power or +13 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Scorch
secondary_data.why: Scorch is a fantastic lane phase choice for Vlad for harassing with [Q]. The extra bit of damage allows you to keep the pressure up and put your enemy in kill potential range.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+22 Ability Power or +13 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Vladimir.title: Vessel of Destruction
Vladimir.description: Efficient lane trading and empowered healing.

primary_data.name: Phase Rush
primary_data.why: Phase Rush on Vladimir allows you to chase down and position for a second round of spell rotations. Vlad can be easily kited and Phase Rush helps mitigate that.
primary_data.description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 attacks or separate abilities grants a burst of MS.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: Vlad's [R] acts as both an opportunity for kill potential as well as safety from getting killed thanks to the heal. More [R]s means more power.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: The biggest gate to Vlad's power is his cooldowns. Having spells up more often means more damage, more health, and more safety with [W].
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch is a great lane presence rune that scales down as the game goes on. Combined with Taste of Blood, you can take very efficient trades in lane with [Q].
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Taste of Blood
secondary_data.why: Taste of Blood on Vlad allows you further pressure your lane opponent through attrition of health.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Ravenous Hunter
secondary_data.why: Ravenous Hunter further empowers your ability to heal and take efficient trades.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Sion.title: Stack the Bodies Higher
Sion.description: Lane phase poke and harassment with Comet.

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Arcane Comet on Sion in an incredibly reliable source of damage thanks to his natural slows on [Q] and [E]. In the laning phase, paired with Scorch, Comet provides fantastic lane pressure damage when maxing [E] first.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Manaflow Band is your means to mana sustain in the laning phase so that your capable of continuously harassing with [E] and comet.
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: Transcendence is a great rune choice on tanks who are looking to stack a lot of big CDR items and can still benefit massivly from the extra bit of AD or AP after capping.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch is your go-to lane harassment rune. Combined with [E] max and Comet you'll be able to safely harass from a distance when passing [E] through minions.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Iron Skin
secondary_data.why: Iron Skin is a great rune to help you sustain and out-trade during the laning phase. The extra bit of early Armor can also pay off big when trying to turn a jungle gank.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Second Wind
secondary_data.why: Second Wind paired with Iron Skin allows you to take a number of early trades and come out with a health lead.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Sion.title: Death Had Its Chance
Sion.description: Massive health stacking and tower smashing.

primary_data.name: Grasp of the Undying
primary_data.why: Sion's natural % health stacking on [W] synergizes with the oh-hit health stacking on Grasp letting him hit massive health numbers in the late-game.
primary_data.description: Every 4s your next attack on a champion deals bonus damage, heals you, and permanently increases your health.

primary_data.name: Demolish
primary_data.why: With Demolish we can convert the massive health stackng on [W], Grasp, and Overgrowth to big-time tower damage.
primary_data.description: Charge up a powerful attack against a tower while near it.

primary_data.name: Conditioning
primary_data.why: The Armor and Magic Resist you gain from Conditioning are even more effective because you are stacking so heavily on health.
primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

primary_data.name: Overgrowth
primary_data.why: Overgrowth + Sion's [W] passive lets you hit insane health number in the late game.
primary_data.description: Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

secondary_data.name: Manaflow Band
secondary_data.why: Manaflow Ban's massive mana sustain allows you to use your large health pool to widdle away at your opponent's health bar in lane and out-sustian them.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Scorch
secondary_data.why: Scorch's extra bit of lane harass damage allows you to take a lot of trades in the laning phase with long-range [E]'s and come out ahead of your opponent.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Lee Sin can very easily proc Electrocute as his [Q] counts as 2 unique spells. A quick auto after [Q] and Electrocute will go off immediately for that extra bit of burst damage and kill secure.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Dashing with either [Q] or [W] makes for an easy way to get a quick 10 Lethality, giving Lee plenty of early game kill potential.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Zombie Ward
primary_data.why: Zombie Ward's additional vision scales incredibly well on Lee Sin thanks to his natural high ward placement with Tracker's Knife. The extra bit of vision will scale well into the mid game for securing objectives like Dragon and Baron.
primary_data.description: After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place.

primary_data.name: Ravenous Hunter
primary_data.why: The majority of Lee sin's high damage comes in the form of his abilities, specifically [Q] and [R]/ Ravenous Hunter allows you to skirmish often thanks to the extra bit of healing.
primary_data.description: Heal for a percentage of damage dealt with your abilities. Increases with each unique takedown.

secondary_data.name: Triumph
secondary_data.why: Triumph's burst of bonus healing after a kill/assist allows you to get away with some risk tower-dives and survive so that you're able to snowball a lead to victory.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace synergizes well with Lee Sin's high damage and execution nature of [Q]. Combined with Electrocute and Ravenous Hunter, Lee is an incredibly strong dueling jungler.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Lee Sin can very easily proc Electrocute as his [Q] counts as 2 unique spells. A quick auto after [Q] and Electrocute will go off immediately.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Dashing with either [Q] or [W] makes for an easy way to get a quick 10 Lethality, giving Lee plenty of early game kill potential.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Eyeball Collection
primary_data.why: Snowball is the name of the game with Lee, so early kills/assists give Eyeball Collection even more power granting Lee additional early game damage.
primary_data.description: Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain permanent AD or AP, Adaptive for each eyeball plus bonus upon collection completion.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: Lee greatly benefits from *finding angles with high movement speed. Scrapping for early game kills/assists gives Lee the ability to find those angles with Relentless Hunter.
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Cooldown Reduction allows Lee Sin to further scrap in skirmishes, enabling multiple spell rotations. Transcendence allows him to get some early CDR for free and not punishing him for continuing to build it if need be.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Waterwalking
secondary_data.why: Waterwalking further promotes Lee's ability to find angles for fights with movement speed. It pairs very nicely with Relentless Hunter.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Cheap Shot
secondary_data.why: Cheap Shot on MF is taken as a lane harassment option as you're able to instantly proc the bonus damage easily with [E].
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Zombie Ward
secondary_data.why: Zombie Ward is an all-around great support rune choice. It's effectiveness scales incredibly well with Sightstone and the raw number of wards you place down over the course of the game.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

MissFortune.title: Shock and Awe
MissFortune.description: Lane harass and massive execution damage.

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Arcane Comet can be unreliable, but if procced from MF's [E] it should be easy to hit. Arcane Comet also scales very well with Bonus AD.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Because MF is a caster AD Carry, the mana sustain here allows you to poke throughout lane with [Q].

primary_data.name: Celerity
primary_data.why: Celerity's bonus Movement Speed synergizes well with Miss Fortune's natural Movement Speed from [W]. The secondary effect of Celerity also allows MF to gain a considerable amount of bonus AD when her [W] is active.
primary_data.description: Gain 4% extra MS. Gain extra AP or AD, based on your bonus MS, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch on MF is a great lane harass and early-game rune thanks to her ease of proccing with [E]. The Magic damage also helps diversify MF's damage type a bit in the early game to she is a slightly more difficult to itemize against.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Triumph
secondary_data.why: Triumph allows you to take close fights in the early laning phase and turn that single kill into a double thanks to the bonus healing.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace synergizes incredibly well with MF's massively high damage [Q] and [R], putting any squishy target with poor positioning in easy kill range.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Electrocute is a great rune for Shaco's natural high-burst assassination playstyle, allowing you to pipck up quick early kill and snowball.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Sudden Impact empowers Shaco's damage in ganks when using [Q]. He also makes great use of both the Lethality and Magic Pen thanks to his mixed damage profile.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Eyeball Collection
primary_data.why: Eyeball Collection is a great rune choice on champions who rely heavily on early snowball kills and those who build Duskblade for the faster ward-sweeping stacks.
primary_data.description: Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain permanent AD or AP, Adaptive for each eyeball plus bonus upon collection completion.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: Relentless Hunt on Shaco allows you to cover more ground during the [Q] stealth so that you're able to position perfectly for the kill.
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
secondary_data.why: The bonus Attack Speed empowers Shaco's ability to quickly clear the jungle for early ganks. It also empowers the damage of your ganks by allowing you to get off an extra auto attack or more during your combo.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace is the go-to assassination rune for those champions (like Shaco) who rely heavily on blowing up squishy backline champions.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.description: Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging or shielding allies.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: Mordekaiser has no mana costs, making his use of a rune like Manaflow Band completely useless. More [R]s from Ultimate Hat means more kill threat and lane pressure damage.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Celerity
primary_data.why: The bonus Movement Speed from Celerity is especially useful in scenarios for Mordekaiser because a large majority of his damage comes from being able to stick to his target.
primary_data.description: Gain 4% extra MS. Gain extra AP or AD, based on your bonus MS, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch is a fantastic lane dominance rune that provides a lot of damage for early trades/fights. Look to proc the bonus damage with an [E] every time is comes off of cooldown.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Triumph
secondary_data.why: As a short-range bruiser you wind up soaking a lot of damage in fights. The bonus healing form Triumph helps a lot in absorbing that damage, picking up kills/assists, and still being able to continue on in the fight.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.description: After immobilizing an enemy champion gain defenses and later deal a burst of adaptive damage around you.

primary_data.name: Font of Life
primary_data.why: Font of Life is a great rune on Thresh as he has multiple tools of proccing it with [Q], [E], and [R], providing a lot of healing in lane trades and team fights.
primary_data.description: Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them. Your allies heal when attacking champion's you've marked.

primary_data.name: Iron Skin
primary_data.why: The Armor from Iron Skin is incredibly valuable in lane trades, especially when looking for that level 2 engage.
primary_data.description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.

primary_data.name: Second Wind
primary_data.why: Second Wind's in-combat sustain further empowers your ability to take trades, and the health you regenerate back is multiplicative with the armor from Iron Skin.
primary_data.description: Restore health over time based on your missing health.

secondary_data.name: Future's Market
secondary_data.why: Future's Market on Thresh allows you to stretch your limited gold income into much faster high utility item power spikes like Locket, redemption, etc.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.why: The extra bit of Summoner and Spell CDR on Thresh pays off big when you are looking for big game-winning plays like Flash->[Q] etc. The extra bit of CDR also allows you to provide more utility and CC in teamfights.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Triumph
secondary_data.why: Triumph allows you to dive towers or the back-line with an all-in combo and the ability to get out alive afterward, thanks to the massive heal.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace is the ultimate rune for assassins looking to execute squishy targets. The bonus damage is easily accessible on a high damage kit such as Talon's.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Shyvana is a fantastic user of Press the Attack thanks to her ability to instantly proc it with an Auto->[Q] reset. The instant exposure allows Shyvana to duel and shred champions effectively.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph on Shyvana allows you to dive into the back line, absorb the brunt of the damage for your team, and heal for a ton from any kills or assists to keep fighting.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: More Attack Speed means a faster/healthier jungle clear and more dueling potential in early skirmishes.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Coup De Grace is the go-to tune for reliable damage in fights where you're able to get to the back-line and shred the enemy squishy champions.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Iron Skin
secondary_data.why: The early bonus Armor from Iron Skin allows you to come out of your first few jungle clear incredibly healthy and ready to fight at any moment. the bonus Armor secondary also synergizes well with Shyv's passive.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Unflinching
secondary_data.why: Unflinching allows you to dive onto enemy champions with [R] while Smiting them and sticking to them thanks to the Slow Resist/Tenacity so you are able to ramp up your damage and kill anyone you set your sights on.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Swain.title: Another Opponent, Another Disappointment
Swain.description: Lane harass and sustained teamfight damage.

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Swain is great lane abuser of Comet thanks to the heavy slow from [Q] nearly guaranteeing a hit.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Manaflow Band allows you to keep up the lane pressure and harassment with constant use of abilities.
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Absolute Focus
primary_data.why: As Swain you should be able to stay within Absolute Focus damage bonus range more than most other champions thanks to the healing from [R] and Ravenous Hunter.
primary_data.description: While above 70% health, gain up to +40 Ability Power or +28 Attack Damage (based on level), Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch is an incredibly strong early laning rune for pressure and harassment. Look to proc the bonus damage as often as possible with either [Q] or [E].
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Cheap Shot
secondary_data.why: Once Rylai's has been completed you will be able to repetitively proc Cheap Shot's bonus True Damage in teamfights with [Q], [R], and [E] to multiple targets.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Ravenous Hunter
secondary_data.why: Ravenous Hunter doubles down on the bruiser-healing nature of Swain kit, allowing you to sustain more damage as you dish it out.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Udyr.title: Fury of the Tiger
Udyr.description: Tiger Stance: Massive jungle control and rapid bleed stacking.

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: With a Tiger Stance focused build, Press the Attack synergizes incredibly well with your ability to quickly proc the exposure damage and stack the bleeds for rapidly increasing damage.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph allows you to dive into the enemy and slice them up in teamfights and keep on going thanks to the massive heal after each kill.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: More Attack Speed means a faster/healthier jungle clear, more map control, and much faster kills/stack of Press the Attack.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune for slicing up squishy targets as quickly as possible. The execution damage allows your double-stacked bleeds to hit like a truck.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Celerity
secondary_data.why: Celerity empowers your ability to traverse the map much more quickly than otherwise possible, allowing you to power-farm and hit item/level power-spikes way sooner than the enemy is expecting.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Waterwalking
secondary_data.why: Waterwalking furthers your ability to control the jungle with map presence. The extra AD also allows you to sneak some early dragons/Rift Herald for more objective control.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Illaoi.title: Teach ‘Em a Harsh Lesson
Illaoi.description: Lane sustain, pressure, and item scaling.

primary_data.name: Kleptomancy
primary_data.why: Illaoi is one of the few melee champions who can reliably proc Kleptomancy in short trades. Her [W] allows her to quickly proc the effect for extra gold and sustain.
primary_data.description: Your first attack after using an ability on champions grants gold and sometimes consumables.

primary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
primary_data.why: Biscuit Delivery combined with the extra potions that you loot with Klepto allows you to take short lane trades and out-sustain your opponent laner.
primary_data.description: Get a free biscuit every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes. Biscuits heal and permanently increase your max mana.

primary_data.name: Magical Footwear
primary_data.why: Magical Footwear is a stable and reliable rune on all champions as it acts effectively as a free kill's worth of gold at 10mins allowing you to hit  damage power spikes a little sooner.
primary_data.description: You get free boots at 10 min. but you cannot buy boots before then. These boots give additional MS. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.

primary_data.name: Celestial Body
primary_data.why: Celestial Body is your primary form of defensive stats from runes. This setup opts heavily for damage and sustain, with very little defense. Celestial Body acts as a means of making sure you don't get blown up early in the game.
primary_data.description: +100 permanent health at the cost of early champion damage.

secondary_data.name: Sudden Impact
secondary_data.why: Sudden Impact is a great rune choice for maximum damage on Illaoi as her [W] leap counts as a dash, granting you Lethality for every bit of damage afterwards.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+27 Ability Power or +16 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Ravenous Hunter
secondary_data.why: Ravenous Hunter's extra bit of Spell Vamp is incredibly strong when paired with Illaoi's high base damage on her abilities and Tentacle Slams, allows you to do sustain through any incoming damage while you blow up the enemy team.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+27 Ability Power or +16 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Electrocute is the go-to rune for lane assassination power and Wukong is easily able proc it with a [E]->Auto->[Q].
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Sudden Impact provides you the bonus Lethality you need to execute squishy targets when jumping in with [E]. You're also able to re-proc the effect when you come out of stealth from [W].
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Eyeball Collection
primary_data.why: Wukong top is all about assassination and snowballing off kills. Eyeball collection does just that, granting you more power for every kill and assist you pick up.
primary_data.description: Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain permanent AD or AP, Adaptive for each eyeball plus bonus upon collection completion.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: Relentless Hunter with Ghostblade allows you to sprint at an enemy from lane or in ganks to get in range for an [E] and blow them up.
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: Triumph
secondary_data.why: Triumph grants you some agency in teamfights where you're able to dive the back-line and pick up a kill before dying. That kill will grant you the health needed to get out safely or move onto the next target.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune for assassins and champions who are looking to kill squishies quickly.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Heimerdinger.title: The Formula for Success
Heimerdinger.description: Oppressive lane pressure and item efficiency.

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Heimerdinger's constant lane harass, stun/slow with [E], and Rylai's, allows him to consistently land Comet for increase lane pressure and kill potential.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: The Ultimate Hat on Heimerdinger ensures you'll have [R] up for every jungle gank be it enemy or teammate allows you to out-play and pick up multiple kills.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: Transcendence puts you at CDR cap in the mid-game with just Morello's and Zhonya's enabling you to itemize into Magic Penetration early.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch empowers your ability to abuse your enemy laner in the early to mid game and press your lead. Heimer, like Teemo, is all about applying early pressure and not letting up.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Perfect Timing
secondary_data.why: Zhonya's is a key ingredient to Heimerdinger's arsenal of items and Perfect timing allows you to hit that item power spike before your enemy knows what hit 'em.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
secondary_data.why: More CDR means more lane harass and more pressure on the enemy. The extra little bit of Summoner CDR also means when the enemy matches your Teleport top you'll have the advantage when it comes back up.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Xerath.title: Be Their Undoing
Xerath.description: Oppressive lane harass and efficient power-spikes.

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Arcane Comet can really shine on poke champions who are able to proc the effect from a long distance.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Manaflow Band is what makes Xerath Support possible. His [Q] and [W] mana costs are extremely high with without Manaflow you're going to struggle poking and harassing in lane.
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: As an AP damage support you won't be opting for nearly as many CDR items as you would otherwise. Transcendence allows you to still 30-40% CDR in teh mid-game while building more AP heavy items.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch is the bread-and-butter of Xerath support as it further empowers your poking and oppressive damage in lane.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Magical Footwear
secondary_data.why: Magical Footwear is a valuable and safe rune option on nearly all champions (minus roaming supports), acting effectively as a kill's worth of gold at 10mins.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
secondary_data.why: More CDR means more spell casts/poke and thus more lane harass, playing up on your strengths.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Xerath.title: The Brink of Infinity
Xerath.description: Lane poke pressure and back-line teamfight damage.

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Comet's poking nature allows you to repeatedly proc Comet for additional harass damage. If procced with [W] or [E] you're much more likely to Lane the Comet thanks to the slow/stun.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Manaflow combined with Xerath's passive provides you massive mana sustain. Xerath has massive mana costs on [Q] and [W] so make sure to use those abilities to get the refund.
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: Transcendence allows Xerath to hit 30% CDR with Morello's alone for a massively powerful mid-game poke and harass.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.why: Xerath excels at poking in lane and Scorch is the ultimate lane dominance rune. Combined with Comet, Scorch should easily put your target in Coup De Grace range very quickly.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Triumph
secondary_data.why: Triumph is an all-around solid rune choice on any champion. The extra heal on kill/assists allows you to continue on in fights.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune for mid-lane mages who are looking to pump out maximum damage to back-line targets.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Nocturne can quickly and easily proc Electrocute on his ganks with an [R]->[E]->[Q] for massive burst and shred potential.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Sudden Impact further empowers your ganks, granting you bonus Lethality when diving in with [R] so you're capable of killing your target ASAP.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.why: Eyeball Collection is all about snowballing your lead from kills with [R]. Nocturne is also a natural builder of Duskblade and the ward sweeping nature of Duskblade empowers your ability pick up more stacks.
primary_data.description: Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain permanent AD or AP, Adaptive for each eyeball plus bonus upon collection completion.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: The bonus Movement Speed from Relentless Hunter allows you to quickly get into position to react to a fight with a well-timed [R].
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: The Ultimate Hat is the core of this setup, allowing you to keep your [R] on a cooldown of ~80s in the mid-game.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Transcendence allows you to hit 40% CDR in the mid-game with just Duskblade and Ghostblade.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Dark Harvest
primary_data.why: Nocturne synergizes well with Dark Harvest's front-loaded burst and power-farming nature. He's able to pick up a stack and effectively utilize it by getting into range of an [R]. The massive burst from your ganks with Dark Harvest makes kill on squishy targets very effective.
primary_data.description: Champions, large minions, and large monsters drop soul essence on death. Touch souls to absorb them and deal bonus adaptive damage on your next attack based on total soul essence collected.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Sudden Impact further empowers your ganks, granting you bonus Lethality when diving in with [R] so you're capable of killing your target ASAP.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Eyeball Collection
primary_data.why: Eyeball Collection is all about snowballing your lead from kills with [R]. Nocturne is also a natural builder of Duskblade and the ward sweeping nature of Duskblade empowers your ability pick up more stacks.
primary_data.description: Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain permanent AD or AP, Adaptive for each eyeball plus bonus upon collection completion.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: The bonus Movement Speed from Relentless Hunter allows you to pick up a Dark Harvest stack and run to a lane to get into range of a well-timed [R].
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
secondary_data.why: The bonus attack speed from Alacrity serves double-duty for Nocturne, allowing him a much faster clear (and more Dark Harvest stacks) with more auto attacks, and a healthier clear thanks to more passive procs.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune when looking to execute squishy champions. The bonus damage allows you to dive onto an enemy and kill them as quickly as possible.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Ornn.title: Show Them the Horns
Ornn.description: Ranged matchups: Lane sustain and diving tankiness.

primary_data.name: Aftershock
primary_data.why: Aftershock's massive addition of tankiness allows Ornn to dive into the enemy team during fights with [E] and absorb a ton of damage.
primary_data.description: After immobilizing an enemy champion gain defenses and later deal a burst of adaptive damage around you.

primary_data.name: Unflinching
primary_data.why: Unflinching allows you to stick to enemy champions for a Brittle auto in fight fights. Ornn is incredibly susceptible to being kited before he can get into position for an [E] knock-up.
primary_data.description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance for each summoner spell on cooldown. Immediately after casting a Summoner Spell, gain a larger burst of Tenacity and Slow Resistance for a moderate duration.

primary_data.name: Iron Skin
primary_data.why: AD Matchups: In tough ranged AD matchups (Jayce/Quinn) take Iron Skin to help you survive in lane.
primary_data.description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.

primary_data.name: Revitalize
primary_data.why: Revitalize's bonus shielding is incredibly strong paired with the shield from Ornn's [W], allowing you to absorb a lot more damage well timed well.
primary_data.description: Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

secondary_data.name: Manaflow Band
secondary_data.why: Manaflow Band grants you the mana sustain you need to stay in lane as long as possible so that you're able to effectively use your passive and abuse item power-spikes.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Celerity
secondary_data.why: Celerity's bonus Movement Speed grants you the bonus speed necessary to stick your target in fights and position for a well-placed [E] knock-up.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

primary_data.name: Grasp of the Undying
primary_data.why: Like the old Grasp, but better. Ornn is always looking for auto attacks when trading because he want's to proc his brittle.
primary_data.description: Every 4s your next attack on a champion deals bonus damage, heals you, and permanently increases your health.

primary_data.name: Font of Life
primary_data.why: Ornn can quite easily apply Font to a large number of targets in teamfights with [Q], [E], and [R]. Stacking health will provide a lot of healing to teammates.
primary_data.description: Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them. Your allies heal when attacking champion's you've marked.

primary_data.name: Conditioning
primary_data.why: As a top laner you'll be building a lot of Armor and Magic Resist allowing granting Conditioning a lot of value in bonus resists.
primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

primary_data.name: Second Wind
primary_data.why: Lane sustain is the name of the game for Ornn because he doesn't have to recall for items. Second Wind provides your needed health regen. after trades.
primary_data.description: Restore health over time based on your missing health.

secondary_data.name: Future's Market
secondary_data.why: Future's Market pairs incredibly well with Ornn's Passice allowing him to not only buy in lane, but also earlier than usual.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
secondary_data.why: Biscuits now provides a lot of health and mana regen allowing you to stay in lane even longer and press your lead.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

Tristana.title: Here Comes the Boom
Tristana.description: Snowballing ganks and massive burst. From Afreeca Freecs Spirit

primary_data.why: Press the Attack pairs well with Tristana's [E], exposing the enemy after 3 auto attacks empowering her bomb explosion for massive burst.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph allows Trist to massively heal after every kill so she can reset her [W] and and jump to the next enemy champion to keep fighting.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: More Attack Speed means a faster and healthier jungle clear as well as a faster [E]/Press the Attack stack on ganks.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Tristana jungle is all about jumping onto squishy targets and blowing them up so she can jump again. Coup De Grace helps you kill those squishies extra fast.

secondary_data.name: Absolute Focus
secondary_data.why: Absolute Focus' bonus AD when coming out of the jungle for a gank provides you with massive burst for a quick kill and reset on [W].

secondary_data.why: Waterwalking allows you to take quick and early scuttle control thanks to your massive AD stacking early with Absolute Focus and Waterwalking.

Tristana.title: Super Rapid Fire
Tristana.description: Maximum Attack Speed with Rapid Fire.

primary_data.why: Attack Speed is the name of the game with Tristana and Lethal Tempo allows you to really embrace that. Pair it with her [Q] and you'll be reaching incredibly high attack speed numbers early.
primary_data.description: 1.5s after damaging a champion gain a large amount of attack speed. Lethal Tempo allows you to temporarily exceed the attack speed limit.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph is Dangerous Game on steroids, allowing you to push your limits in fights and reset, Rocket Jump in, and continue fighting healthily. Oh and bonus kill gold is nice too.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: Tristana is a heavily auto attack focused Marksman so more Attack Speed is always welcome.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Tristana really wants to finish off her target ASAP so she is able to get the cooldown reset on her [W] and continue fighting or jump to safety. Coup De Grace help in that department.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Perfect Timing

Hecarim.title: Off to the Races

primary_data.why: Predator's active Movement Speed buff synergizes incredibly well with Hecarim's [E] and passive when looking to sprint into a lane for a gank.

primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

primary_data.name: Second Wind
primary_data.why: Second Wind synergizes incredibly well with Doran's shield and Garen's passive, allowing you to take numerous early trades and regen substantially.
primary_data.description: Restore health over time based on your missing health.

secondary_data.name: Triumph
secondary_data.why: Triumph's massive heal allows you to take the brunt of the enemy damage, as a front liner, and keep moving by picking up kills or an [R] execution.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace's execution nature synergizes very well with the execution damage pattern of Garen's [R], securing kills that may otherwise not be possible.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

DrMundo.title: Always Be Cleaving
DrMundo.description: Power-farm jungling and effective dueling. By: Riot Jatt

primary_data.name: Guardian
primary_data.why: Guardian is often an underrated rune on tank junglers. Can be even better if your team has multiple tanks and you dive into fights together.
primary_data.description: Guard allies you cast spells on and those that are very nearby. If you or a guarded ally would take damage, you're both hasted and granted a shield.

primary_data.name: Demolish
primary_data.why: There is some choice here between Demolish and Font of Life.
primary_data.description: Cooldown: 45s

primary_data.name: Conditioning
primary_data.why: More often than not taking Conditioning in the jungle is incredibly valuable option as you're not pitted against a particular opponent.
primary_data.description: Charge up a powerful attack against a tower while near it.

primary_data.name: Overgrowth
primary_data.why: Mundo has an incredibly fast jungle clear and takes advantage of Overgrowth's stacking nature more abruptly.
primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

secondary_data.name: Cheap Shot
secondary_data.why: Thanks to Mundo's almost permanent slowing with [Q], Cheap Shot allows you to repeatedly proc the true damage and whittle away any opponent.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Ravenous Hunter
secondary_data.why: The majority of Mundo's damage comes in the form of abilities. [Q]s high base damage will provide a ton of healing and greatly improves your dueling/survivability.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Rek'sai's heavily auto-attack based damage pattern and ability to auto-reset with [Q] makes her a great user of Press the Attack.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph allows you to dive deep into the backline with an [R] and get out safely if you execute them, thanks to the massive heal from Triumph.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: More Attack Speed on Rek'Sai mean a faster Press the Attack proc and a much faster/healthier jungle clear.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Coup De Grace is a well-rounded reliable damage rune in this slot and synergizes insanely well with the execution of Rek'Sai's [R].
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Transcendence allows you to hit 40% CDR with just Warrior Smite and Black Cleaver.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Waterwalking
secondary_data.why: Waterwalking allows you to take control of the river with faster scuttle kills and dragon control. If you find yourself in a skirmish in the river, the bonus AD will help you come out ahead.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

primary_data.name: Aftershock
primary_data.why: Nautilus is one of the premier users of Aftershock thanks to his numerous forms of CC. His passive, [Q], and [R] with all grant you the bonus Armor and MR for surviving trades/all-ins.
primary_data.description: After immobilizing an enemy champion gain defenses and later deal a burst of adaptive damage around you.

primary_data.name: Font of Life
primary_data.why: Font of Life is a fantastic support Nautilus rune choice thanks to his ability to easily proc the effect on a large number of enemy champions in teamfights.
primary_data.description: Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them. Your allies heal when attacking champion's you've marked.

primary_data.name: Iron Skin
primary_data.why: Iron Skin is the defacto rune choice for melee supports as the early armor allows you to take trades in lane efficiently.
primary_data.description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.

primary_data.name: Revitalize
primary_data.why: Revitalize empowers your defensive utility as a support. The bonus healing/shielding applies to Font of Life, Redemption, Locket and your [W].
primary_data.description: Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

secondary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
secondary_data.why: Biscuit Delivery is a fantastic sustain option for tank champions in lane any. The Biscuit heals for a % of your missing health, so if you proc it in a fight when you're relatively low you'll gain massive regen.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Celestial Body
secondary_data.why: Celestial Body on Nautilus support allows you to tank the brunt of damage in early lane trades with your massive health pool. The extra health also slightly empowers your Font of Life healing and [W] shield.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

Kled.title: They’s About to Be Dead
Kled.description: Maximum damage output and dueling power.

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Press the Attack synergizes well with Kled's [W], allowing you to use the first 3 auto attack to proc the exposure and the 4th empower auto to hit extra hard.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph is an all-around valuable rune for staying alive in teamfight. It allows you to dive for a kill, take a lot of damage, and continue fighting thanks to the heal.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: Kled's entire kit is designed around empowering his ability to land more auto attacks. The more autos you can get off in a fight directly relates to how much damage you're doing.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Coup De Grace is a fantastic default damage rune in this slot that allows you to finish of low health targets much more reliably.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Sudden Impact
secondary_data.why: Kled makes great use of Sudden Impact's Lethality thanks to his ability to dash twice with [E]. If you hit your target with [E] and stagger the reactivation you can keep the Lethality buff active on yourself for 10s+.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Ingenious Hunter
secondary_data.why: The primary purpose for Ingenious Hunter on Kled is to massively increase up-time of Titanic Hydra. With max stacks, Titanic Hydra is on a 12s cooldown, allowing you to use it multiple times in a fight.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Electrocute is a fantastic assassination rune on Rengar thanks to his ability to almost instantly proc it with a Leap->[Q]->[W]. The extra burst allows you to secure your kills in a single rotation of spell.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Sudden Impact is a no-brainer on Rengar. He is a natural abuser of dashes thanks to his passive. With good positioning around bushes you should be able to keep the buff active at all times granting you permanent free Lethality.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Zombie Ward
primary_data.why: Zombie Ward is a safe a reliable rune on every Jungle thanks to the nature of their vision control and ability to deep ward.
primary_data.description: After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: Relentless Hunter is a massive buff to Rengar's [R], allow you to travel much further distances with just a few stacks. The bonus Movement Speed also allows you to get around the map to meet fights in a timely manner.
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: Rengar becomes a scary threat when he is ahead and his [R] is up. More chances to cast [R] means more kills and that's what Rengar is all about.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Transcendence allows you to build Black Cleaver and Lethality items freely without fear of wasting gold on over-capping CDR.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Press the Attack allows Aatrox to take short trades for burst and exit to out-sustain his lane opponent. The expose damage also synergies well with his [W] empowered damage.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: As an auto attack focused carry top, more Attack Speed means more damage (and more healing with [W]).
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Coup De Grace is a solid all-around damage rune choice, allowing you to out trade and sustain your lane opponent to keep them in kill range.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Sudden Impact
secondary_data.why: Sudden Impact synergizes well with Aatrox's all-in/dive play pattern, empowering the damage of his [Q], Autos, and [E]. The bonus Magic Penetration also slightly empowers his [R] damage.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
secondary_data.why: A few stack of Relentless Hunter allows you to roam the map and find dives with your passive.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Irelia.title: There’s no turning back
Irelia.description: Sustained fighting power and ramping damage.

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: The bonus exposure damage from Press the Attack further empowers your auto attacks and lets you deal immense ramping damage in extended duels.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph is an all-around solid rune choice. In 2v2s and 2v1s, the extra healing can be enough to grant you the ability to sustain and move on to the next target.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: The majority of Irelia's damage comes in the form of her Auto Attacks thanks to her [W]. Alacrity grants you the opportunity for an additional 1-2 autos when the enemy is stunned with [E]
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Coup De Grace allows Irelia to continue chipping away at her target until their life bar is fully depleted.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Second Wind
secondary_data.why: Second Wind is a fantastic mid-fight sustain rune when taking small-medium trades in lane. It allows you to stay healthy as you beat on your target.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Iron Skin
secondary_data.why: Iron Skin is a great rune for early-game dueling power. The bonus armor is extra beneficial with the healing from your [W] and sustain from Second Wind.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: The bonus exposure damage from Press the Attack further empowers her True Damage auto attacks and lets her deal immense damage in duels.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Overheal
primary_data.why: Overheal is a rune that synergizes well with Irelia's healing from [W] and [R] and the Life Steal from Botrk, to keep her topped off with a shield.
primary_data.description: Excess healing on you becomes a shield.

primary_data.name: Legend: Tenacity
primary_data.why: Tenacity is a great stat on Irelia so she can stick to her target and continue building up auto attacks.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Tenacity.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Coup De Grace allows Irelia to continue chipping away at her target until their life bar is fully depleted.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Sudden Impact
secondary_data.why: Irelia can regularly proc Sudden Impact with [Q] to sustain the Lethality buff and kill her target while you chases them down.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Zombie Ward
secondary_data.why: Zombie Ward is a solid vision option for further empowering the vision from your Trinket wards.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Fiddlesticks.title: The Crows are Circling
Fiddlesticks.description: Heavy CDR and maximum engage potential.

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: If you're able to cast [Q] on an enemy before, or shortly after, dealing damage the Movement Speed slow on the fear is enough to make the Comet undodgeable.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: Fiddle's ganking potential when his [R] is down is next-to-none. The more your [R] is off of cooldown the more opportunities you have for ganks and kills.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: Fiddle typically wants to start building in AP itemization as quickly as he can. With Transcendence your mid-game scales decently as you can start building full AP after completing Zhonya's.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Gathering Storm
primary_data.why: Gathering Storm is your late-game insurance policy as Fiddle's [R] has a reasonably good AP ratio and scales well to win your team teamfights.
primary_data.description: Gain increasing amounts of AD or AP, Adaptive over the course of the game.

secondary_data.name: Perfect Timing
secondary_data.why: Perfect Timing allows you the freedom of hard engages early with the safety of Stopwatch and an efficient mid-game with a cheaper buy on Zhonya's.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
secondary_data.why: Cosmic Insight is an all-around solid rune on any champion in any position. The summoner CDR gives you a few more Flashes for engage and a number of more Smite opportunities.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Aftershock
primary_data.why: Aftershock is the go-to rune on any engage tank. After jumping in with [E], the bonus Armor and MR allows your to survive the engage while sticking to your target and CCing them.
primary_data.description: After immobilizing an enemy champion gain defenses and later deal a burst of adaptive damage around you.

primary_data.name: Unflinching
primary_data.why: Unflinching allows you to continue to stick to your target after jumping in. After Zac has engaged with[E], it can be difficult to stay on top of enemy champions and spam [W] (your primary source damage).
primary_data.description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance for each summoner spell on cooldown. Immediately after casting a Summoner Spell, gain a larger burst of Tenacity and Slow Resistance for a moderate duration.

primary_data.name: Conditioning
primary_data.why: Conditioning scales well with Aftershock, as both of them buff each other. The bonus resist from Aftershock make Conditioning stronger, and Conditioning resists after 10mins make Aftershock stronger.
primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

primary_data.name: Revitalize
primary_data.why: Zac does a lot of natural self healing when he pick ups his bobs. Revitalize empowers your jungle clear with a much healthier first clear.
primary_data.description: Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Transcendence allows you to bypass early game CDR for more defensive based items (Randuins etc.) while still granting you the CDR for [W] spam and CC lockup.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Scorch
secondary_data.why: Scorch heavily empowers your early to mid game ganks opening the opportunity for snowballing lanes.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Arcane Comet is a relatively abusable keystone for Lissandra thanks to the very short cooldown and slow on [Q]. [Q] harass with Comet and Scorch will result in a lot of chip damage during lane.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: The Ultimate Hat grants Lissandra fantastic safety and kill pressure. At 45% CDR and max Hat stacks, your ult is down to 32s.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Absolute Focus
primary_data.why: Absolute Focus empowers your ability to harass in lane with long range [Q]s through the minion wave for even more empowered damage.
primary_data.description: While above 70% health, gain up to +40 Ability Power or +28 Attack Damage (based on level), Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch is a fantastic lane harass rune, and pairs incredibly well with Aery to keep the pressure up.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
secondary_data.why: Biscuit Delivery is a great rune in match-ups where you're intending to sustain in lane for larger back timings. If timed well (when low health) in fights, the massive sustain can be the difference between life and death.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Future's Market
secondary_data.why: Future's Market on Lissandra allows you to hit an earlier Rod of Ages purchase to begin stacking sooner than normal, making your mid game incredibly strong if you're not behind..
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Draven.title: Hit ’em Where It Hurts
Draven.description: Maximum damage and late game scaling.

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Draven benefits massively from the bonus exposure damage of Press the Attack paired with his [Q] for ending people's lives in a heartbeat.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Taking Triumph lets you fight to the death and hold your group for the kill, coming out the other side with massive health to keep fighting.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Bloodline
primary_data.why: Bloodline synergizes incredibly well with Draven bonus damage on [Q] and the exposure damage of Press the Attack, allowing you to duel and sustain in lane.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Lifesteal.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: The bonus damage on Coup De Grace allows you exert your dominance over bot lane and snowball by executing low health targets.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Celerity
secondary_data.why: Celerity's bonus Movment Speed grants you a little freedom in catching axes. At also allows your [W] to become a small AD steroid.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Gathering Storm
secondary_data.why: Gathering Storm is your late game insurance policy on damage. Draven is not typically an AD Carry that scales well into the late game, but Gathering Storm helps patch up some of those issues.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Draven.title: Something need killin’?
Draven.description: Life steal sustain, and raw damage execution.

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Draven benefits massively from the bonus exposure damage of Press the Attack paired with his [Q] for ending people's lives in a heartbeat.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Overheal
primary_data.why: Draven's itemization tends to lean heavy on Life Steal thanks to his [Q]s damage, allowing him to keep an Overheal shield up very reliably.
primary_data.description: Excess healing on you becomes a shield.

primary_data.name: Legend: Bloodline
primary_data.why: Bloodline further allows you to keep a healthy Overheal shield up as well as synergizing well with his already heavy Life Steal itemization.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Lifesteal.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Draven is all about ending squishy target's lives as soon as possible and Coup De Grace's execution damage makes his [Q] damage insane.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Taste of Blood
secondary_data.why: Combined with Life Steal and Overheal, Taste of Blood lets you take a lot of early skirmish fights for lane control.

secondary_data.name: Eyeball Collection
secondary_data.why: Draven loves nothing more to snowball and continue to spiral the game off kills. Eyeball Collection grants you even more AD for those kills.

primary_data.name: Summon Aery
primary_data.why: Aery is a fantastic lane harass rune for Pantheon. Spamming [Q] in lane will repeatedly proc Aery for bonus Magic damage, and your all-ins will result in multiple procs thanks to your close range.
primary_data.description: Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging or shielding allies.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Manaflow Band acts as your primary source of mana regen so that you can harass constantly with [Q].
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Celerity
primary_data.why: Celerty's bonus Movement Speed allows you to chase down your target and keep in range for [Q]s and [W].
primary_data.description: Gain 4% extra MS. Gain extra AP or AD, based on your bonus MS, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Along with Aery, Scorch is a fantastic rune for lane harass and poke. The extra bit of damage can easily be enough to determine the difference between a kill and survival.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Sudden Impact
secondary_data.why: Sudden Impact empowers your all-in combo, as you [W] acts as a dash. The bonus Lethality pushes your Aery, Scorch, and ability damage into kill threat.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Eyeball Collection
secondary_data.why: Pantheon often plays as a bit of a cheese pick, looking to assassinate and snowball to a victory. His late game falls off incredibly hard and Eyeball Collection lets you play up on further empowering an aggressive early game.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Arcane Comet is a solid offensive rune choice for Jhin thanks to its high Bonus AD scaling. If procced when using [W] for a root or [R], it's almost guaranteed to hit.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Manaflow Band provides you the mana sustain so you can start Doran's Blade instead of the typical Doran's Ring.
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Celerity
primary_data.why: Jhin is one of the fastest moving AD Carries in the game thanks to his passive, Zeal stacking, and tendency to build Ghostblade allowing you to position better for your 4th shot.
primary_data.description: Gain 4% extra MS. Gain extra AP or AD, based on your bonus MS, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch is an all-around solid lane harass rune. You should be able to proc it relatively easily with [Q] or [W].
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
secondary_data.why: Biscuit Delivery offer you an immense amount of health sustain during the laning phase to help you overcome to sometime oppressive amounts of poke and harass in the early game.

secondary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
secondary_data.why: Cosmic Insight's extra bit of CDR helps to empower your role as a long range utility AD Carry.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Fleet Footwork
primary_data.why: Jhin loves the healing from Fleet Footwork for sustain, but the movement speed to get into 4th shot range is the real kicker here.
primary_data.description: Attacking and moving builds energy stacks. At 100 stacks, your next attack heals you and grants increased MS.

primary_data.name: Overheal
primary_data.why: Thanks to Fleet Footwork it's quite easy to gain a reliable shield to keep you healthy in small trades.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: Attack Speed on Jhin acts as a great AD multiplier, combined with Absolute Focus and Gathering Storm

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Jhin's 4th shot execution damage pattern screams for you to take Coup De Grace so you can quickly and painless execute your target.

secondary_data.name: Absolute Focus

secondary_data.name: Gathering Storm
