Zilean.title: I’ve Seen Their Death
Zilean.description: Wave clear pressure, roams, and maximum utility.

primary_data.name: Unsealed Spellbook
primary_data.why: The key to this build is lane pressure and roaming. Spellbook plus Cosmic Insight allows you to keep your Teleport on a short cooldown so you're able to shove lane and roam.
primary_data.description: Get Summoner Shards and exchange them at the shop to change your Summoner Spells during game.

primary_data.name: Perfect Timing
primary_data.why: Zhonya's and Zilean's [R] grant numerous chances to minimize positioning mistakes.
primary_data.description: Gain a free stopwatch. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

primary_data.name: Minion Dematerializer
primary_data.why: Minion Dematerialzer plays a key role in being able to keep the lane pressure/wave clear up so you're able to leave lane and find ganks or fights with your jungler.
primary_data.description: Start the game with 6 Minion Dematerializers. Killing minions with the item gives permanent bonus damage vs. that minion type.

primary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
primary_data.why: With Zilean's only damage ability being [Q], he heavily relies on the bonus CDR. The extra bit of Summoner CDR also means more TP pressure and Flash safety.
primary_data.description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: At level 16 Zilean's [R] is already pretty short. With max Ultimate Hat stacks that puts you at a 24s cooldown [R] heading into the mid game.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+22 Ability Power or +13 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Transcendence allows you to go Morello's and Lucidity as your only 2 CDR items, while still hitting cap.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+22 Ability Power or +13 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Yorick.title: Their Tomb Awaits
Yorick.description: Massive tower pressure and lane dueling.

primary_data.name: Grasp of the Undying
primary_data.why: Yorick's trading/fighting pattern relies heavily on [Q], therefore auto attacks. Grasp's heal and bonus damage keep you healthy and empower longer duration duels.
primary_data.description: Every 4s your next attack on a champion deals bonus damage, heals you, and permanently increases your health.

primary_data.name: Demolish
primary_data.why: Demolish empowers and emphasizes Yorick's ability to split push and shred towers. If you're left alone by the enemy team you'll have the ability to take several towers if not responded to.
primary_data.description: Charge up a powerful attack against a tower while near it.

primary_data.name: Conditioning
primary_data.why: Conditioning is the greedy rune in this slot. Yorick has strong early laning if you play around your Ghouls well allowing you to pressure safely without the early resists.
primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

primary_data.name: Second Wind
primary_data.why: Second Wind is the rune of choice in this slot if you're looking to fight and take a lot of trades during lane.
primary_data.description: Restore health over time based on your missing health.

secondary_data.name: Legend: Tenacity
secondary_data.why: Every point of Tenacity that you can pick up further empowers your ability to deal damage due to your lack of mobility and having to just run at the enemy.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Yorick does an impressive and unexpected amount of damage. Coup De Grace lets you put that damage to good use to secure kills.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

primary_data.name: Lethal Tempo
primary_data.why: Lethal Tempo allows Xayah to get out her stacked feathers as fast as possible for a bigger [E].
primary_data.description: 1.5s after damaging a champion gain a large amount of attack speed. Lethal Tempo allows you to temporarily exceed the attack speed limit.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph allows you to hold your ground in fights to continue dishing out damage after a kill/assist.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: The bonus Attack Speed allows you to get more feathers out in a a close all-in kiting fight so that you're able to secure the kill.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Coup De Grace is an all-around reliable source of damage when looking trying to kill squishy targets with [E].
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Xayah is an AD Carry who heavily prioritizes CDR in the form of Essence Reaver so that you're able to [E] multiple times in a fight and [R] more often for safety.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Gathering Storm
secondary_data.why: Gathering Storm is your late-game insurance policy. If you can make it to 30mins+ this rune starts becoming a massive source of damage.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: The bonus damage on an exposed enemy from Press the Attack synergies very well with Xayah's [W] bonus damage.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Overheal
primary_data.why: Overheal is an all-around great rune choices on most AD Carries. The shield while small, negates a lot of damage over the course of the game.
primary_data.description: Excess healing on you becomes a shield.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: Attack Speed and more attack speed. Every AD Carry's dream.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Cut Down
primary_data.why: Combine the bonus damage from Press the Attack, Xayah's [W], and this rune, you'll be shredding enemies regardless of their health.
primary_data.description: Deal more damage to champion with more maximum health than you.

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Xayah loves CDR as her primary damage source comes from using abilities to get feathers out.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Gathering Storm
secondary_data.why: Thanks to having an un-targetable [R], you're able to opt into a more offensive rune choice in this slot and Gathering Storm provides a whole lot of that.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Electrocute is the go-to keystone on Riven when looking to do massive burst damage in a short period of time. Her skillset allows her to quickly proc the damage in any trade with [Q]->[W]->Auto.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Riven may be one of the biggest abusers of Sudden Impact. All 3 parts of her [Q] and [E] proc the effect.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Zombie Ward
primary_data.why: Zombie Ward is a fantastic all-around rune choice on any champion thanks to it's incredibly reliable and effective addition of vision.
primary_data.description: After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place.

primary_data.name: Ravenous Hunter
primary_data.why: The bonus healing Ravenous Hunter grants minimizes risk when looking to take aggressive trades and all-ins.
primary_data.description: Heal for a percentage of damage dealt with your abilities. Increases with each unique takedown.

secondary_data.name: Triumph
secondary_data.why: Triumph allows you to dive towers or the back-line with an all-in combo and the ability to get out alive afterward, thanks to the massive heal.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace is the ultimate rune for champions that are looking to execute squishy targets. The bonus damage is easily accessible on a high damage kit such as Riven's.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Nidalee.title: On the Prowl
Nidalee.description: Map mobility, power farming, and assassination.

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Nidalee often acts a lot like an assassin, wanting to land a spear and blow up her target quickly. A Spear->Pounce->Swipe will instantly proc the Electro cute for a ton of damage.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Nidalee's high mobility with Pounce allows her to keep the Magic Penetration and Lethality buff up at almost all times.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Eyeball Collection
primary_data.why: As an assassin, you're wanting to pick up kills around the map from as early in the game as you can. Doubling down on that, we can take Eyeball here for even more power to snowball.
primary_data.description: Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain permanent AD or AP, Adaptive for each eyeball plus bonus upon collection completion.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: Nidlee is a Jungler who excels at clearing her jungle insanely quickly and getting around the map to find any fight she wants.
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: Celerity
secondary_data.why: Celerity synergizes pretty well with Nidalee's passive, granting you more AP when entering a bush. The bonus Movement Speed also furthers your ability to get to fights anywhere on the map.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Waterwalking
secondary_data.why: Waterwalking is one of the highest value runes if you can take advantage of and abuse it while in the river.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Summon Aery
primary_data.why: Aery is taken here for it's reliability and chip damage when trading with [Q].
primary_data.description: Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging or shielding allies.

primary_data.name: Nullifying Orb
primary_data.why: Nullifying Orb lets you take aggressive trades/fights into high-threat AP mages during laning phase.
primary_data.description: Gain a magic damage shield when taken to low health by magic damage.

primary_data.name: Celerity
primary_data.why: In the mid to late game, Viktor has a nearly constant haste thanks to his empowered [Q]. The bonus Movement Speed from [Q] will grant you a bit of an AP steroid.
primary_data.description: Gain 4% extra MS. Gain extra AP or AD, based on your bonus MS, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Combined with Aery, Scorch is a great rune for taking small trades and chipping away at the enemy in lane.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Future's Market
secondary_data.why: Future's Market plays a huge role in overcoming Viktor's pain points of rough buy-timings when rushing his Hex Core upgrades.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
secondary_data.why: Biscuit Delivery provides a great amount of sustain during lane so you can more reliably back on better buy-timings.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Sona.title: Frugal Falsetto
Sona.description: Super efficient item power-spikes and gold saving.

primary_data.name: Kleptomancy
primary_data.why: This rune setup is all about hitting item power-spikes as soon as possible and the bonus gold you get some Klepto can pay itself off insanely quickly if you're playing into an easy melee support lane.
primary_data.description: Your first attack after using an ability on champions grants gold and sometimes consumables.

primary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
primary_data.why: We are looking to save and earn as much gold as we possibly can with this setup and Biscuits (combined with Klepto) allows us to rely on these for sustain, saving you 100s of gold to put into other items.
primary_data.description: Get a free biscuit every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes. Biscuits heal and permanently increase your max mana.

primary_data.name: Magical Footwear
primary_data.why: Continuing the pattern, Magical Footwear is just another source of raw gold income in the form of frugality.
primary_data.description: You get free boots at 10 min. but you cannot buy boots before then. These boots give additional MS. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.

primary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
primary_data.why: Cosmic Insight is simply an overall fantastic rune choice on any champion in the game, but especially supports as they can make great use of the extra item CDR.
primary_data.description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR

secondary_data.name: Manaflow Band
secondary_data.why: You're looking to poke and harass a lot with [Q]->auto in lane, for both pressure as well as Kleptomancy procs. To keep this up and earn as much gold as possible, you're going to need the mana sustain.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+22 Ability Power or +13 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Scorch
secondary_data.why: Because this loadout focuses heavily on [Q] spam and poke in lane, Scorch is a natural option to further empower that damage and keep the pressure up.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+22 Ability Power or +13 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Summon Aery
primary_data.why: Summon Aery is a great option for Sona both offensively (with autos and [Q]) and defensively (with [W]).
primary_data.description: Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging or shielding allies.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Manaflow Band is a great option here for Sona because you're going to want to  play aggressively in lane early spamming [Q].
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: Like all support Transcendence is the best option here as it scales really well with your itemization.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch allows you to dominate the lane phase if you're able to consistently poke with your [Q].
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Zombie Ward
secondary_data.why: To key to being a useful support is effective warding and Zombie Ward shines in this department keeping vision up for you even more.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Ingenious Hunter
secondary_data.why: Sona's itemization is ripe for active items (Locket, Redemption, etc.). Pair Ingenious Hunter's item CDR with Ruby Sightstone and you'll be able to spam your items.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

TahmKench.title: Savor the Misery
TahmKench.description: Top lane dominance and unstoppable tankiness.

primary_data.name: Grasp of the Undying
primary_data.why: Tahm's incredibly strong slow on [Q] allows him to chase down and trade incredibly well in lane with auto attacks. The stacking health on Grasp further empowers his passive.
primary_data.description: Every 4s your next attack on a champion deals bonus damage, heals you, and permanently increases your health.

primary_data.name: Unflinching
primary_data.why: Tahm's biggest downfall is how incredibly immobile and prone to CC/slowing he is. The bonus Tenacity/Slow Resist makes you incredibly hard to het away from once you have Righteous Glory and Mercury's Treads.
primary_data.description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance for each summoner spell on cooldown. Immediately after casting a Summoner Spell, gain a larger burst of Tenacity and Slow Resistance for a moderate duration.

primary_data.name: Iron Skin
primary_data.why: This slot is highly dependent on lane matchup and enemy composition. If you think you can get away with an easy lane (Maokai etc.) you can opt for a greedier choice in Conditioning.
primary_data.description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.

primary_data.name: Overgrowth
primary_data.why: Overgrowth is a rune that allows Tahm to scale, both defensively and offensively, incredibly well. The bonus stacking health further empowers your autos and abilities thanks to Tahm's Passive.
primary_data.description: Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

secondary_data.name: Triumph
secondary_data.why: Triumph is a rune that is deceptively good in it's ability to sustain in teamfights. If you're playing frontline and soaking damage, picking up assists will massively heal you to keep moving forward.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
secondary_data.why: Especially during the laning phase, Tahm relies heavily on the ability to take trades by getting as many autos off as possible. The faster autos means more damage from passive, Grasp, and faster passive stacks.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

primary_data.name: Guardian
primary_data.why: Guardian on Tahm allows him to eat a teammate that is about to take damage, shield, and gain the bonus Movement Speed to allow him to run away and re-position to spit them out.
primary_data.description: Guard allies you cast spells on and those that are very nearby. If you or a guarded ally would take damage, you're both hasted and granted a shield.

primary_data.name: Font of Life
primary_data.why: Like Braum, the combination of [Q] slow and Tahm's natural health stacking allows you to provide decent healing in lane fights.
primary_data.description: Cooldown: 45s

primary_data.name: Conditioning
primary_data.why: The Armor and Magic Resist of Conditioning pairs very well with champions who buy an early Locket to make for a strong mid-game teamfight.
primary_data.description: Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them. Your allies heal when attacking champion's you've marked.

primary_data.name: Revitalize
primary_data.why: Revitalize synergizes well with Tahm's passive shield, FotM, Locket, and healing from Redemption.
primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

secondary_data.name: Approach Velocity
secondary_data.why: Approach Velocity is a great rune on Tahm to assist getting into range to [W] a CCed teammate, and for follow-up chase and damage on an enemy you have hit with [Q].
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
secondary_data.why: Biscuit Delivery allows you to sustian through tough poke lane that might abuse your short range during the laning phase.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

Kennen.title: The Marin Special(ist)
Kennen.description: All about the all-in. FLASHy engages. AP burst.

primary_data.name: Unsealed Spellbook
primary_data.why: This build is ALL ABOUT flashing in with your ultimate and blowing people up. The 25% summoner CDR + Cosmic Insight puts Flash on a 180s cooldown.
primary_data.description: Get Summoner Shards and exchange them at the shop to change your Summoner Spells during game.

primary_data.name: Perfect Timing
primary_data.why: Perfect Timing gives you the safety of a large 5-man Flash->[R] without having to worry about getting blown up.
primary_data.description: Gain a free stopwatch. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

primary_data.name: Future's Market
primary_data.description: You can enter debt to buy items.

primary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
primary_data.why: More Summoner CDR means more Flash all-ins.
primary_data.description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: Kennen is all about his [R], and this loadout in particular places heavy emphasis on spamming [R] and abusing your low Summoner cooldowns to take big teamfights immediately.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+22 Ability Power or +13 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Celerity
secondary_data.why: Celerity actually synergizes incredibly well with Kennen's kit. The bonus Movement Speed from [E] grants you a burst of extra Ability Power during your [R] all-ins.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+22 Ability Power or +13 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Urgot.title: Echoing from the Depths
Urgot.description: Burst damage and meat grinder execution.

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Urgot is a fantastic user of Press the Attack because he is able to almost instantly proc the exposure damage with [W], allowing the rest of his follow-up damage to shred his target.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Urgot is a great lane duelist and Triumph allows you to potentially take a 1v2 against the enemy Jungler, executing the low target with [R], and moving on the kill the other.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Tenacity
primary_data.why: Hard CC is Urgot's biggest proponent holding him back from killing everyone and every thing. More Tenacity will allow you to stick to your target and execute them.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Tenacity.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Coup De Grace is a rune designed to execute, allowing you to quickly get into execution range of your [R].
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Celerity
secondary_data.why: The bonus Movement Speed of Celerity massively empowers your ability to dance around your target during [W] and proc every leg.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: More [R]s means more opportunity to snowball a lead and execute targets on cooldown.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Quinn.title: Gotta Go Fast
Quinn.description: Massive Movement Speed, roaming, and map pressure.

primary_data.name: Predator
primary_data.why: Predator on Quinn combined with the Movement Speed from her [R] makes her an incredibly scary threat across the entire map.
primary_data.description: Add an active effect to your boots that grants a large boost of MS and causes your next attack or spell to deal bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Quinn can make great use of the bonus Lethality when using [E] to blow up her target.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Eyeball Collection
primary_data.why: This build on Quinn is all about zooming around the map and picking up a ton of kills. Eyeball Collection pays off handsomely granting you plenty of damage from all of these kills.
primary_data.description: Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain permanent AD or AP, Adaptive for each eyeball plus bonus upon collection completion.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: More Movement Speed means getting back to lane quicker and putting pressure on any lane when you're not seen by the enemy vision. Roam a LOT.
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: Celerity
secondary_data.why: This rune setup on Quinn is all about Movement Speed and getting around the map to find kills. Celerity's synergy with Predator, Relentless Hunter, and your [R] gives you a ton of AD to blow up your target.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Nullifying Orb
secondary_data.why: Nullifying orb is a stylistic choice here and a very flexible slot.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: As an artillery mage, Ziggs is able to repeatedly proc Comet from safety. His low cooldown on [Q] also allows him to refresh the Comet cooldown quickly.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Ziggs is a champion who can apply a lot of lane pressure with [Q] harass and Scorch procs. Manaflow Band gives you the mana sustain to keep up the pressure.
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: With Transcendence you're able to hit 40% CDR with just Morello's and Lich Bane. With such a low CD on [Q] you can shred towers with your passive, Lich Bane, and [W].
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Between frequent comet procs and Scorch, Ziggs can can rain down lane pressure from afar with accurate [Q]s.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
secondary_data.why: More CDR means more harass and more passive procs on towers for that juicy [W] tower execution.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
secondary_data.why: Biscuits are a great rune choice for lane sustain as well as providing a bit extra mana for all that harass you'll be spittin' out.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Summon Aery
primary_data.why: They key to success with Summon Aery on Zyra is to abuse it's short cooldown through the use of constantly plant attacks and your long range autos.
primary_data.description: Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging or shielding allies.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: This rune page is heavily focused on lane harass and pressure, and to do that you're looking to spam your spells quite a bit. Manaflow empowers you to do more damage with Aery and Scorch.
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Absolute Focus
primary_data.why: Zyra makes great use of the bonus AP from Absolute Focus by staying in the back-line and letting her plants dish out the damage.
primary_data.description: While above 70% health, gain up to +40 Ability Power or +28 Attack Damage (based on level), Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Again this rune page is heavily focused on lane harass and Scorch is good at that, often out-damaging most Keystones early. Constant plants attack with proc this very effectively.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Zombie Ward
secondary_data.why: Zombie Ward can provide a ton of bonus vision for free if you're building Sightstone and placing wards often and is always a very reliable and safe Rune choice for supports.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Cheap Shot
secondary_data.why: Zyra's natural ability to proc constant slows with Rylai's and [E] plants attacks allows her and her plants to repeatedly proc Cheap Shot's True damage adding up to massive amounts throughout the game.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

AurelionSol.title: A Little Star Fire
AurelionSol.description: Map mobility pressure and teamfight scaling.

primary_data.name: Phase Rush
primary_data.why: Aurelion Sol's damage mechanics rely almost entirely on his ability to position himself well from moment to moment. The Movement Speed burst from Phase Rush lets you chase and stay in perfect range for follow-up [W] hits.
primary_data.description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 attacks or separate abilities grants a burst of MS.

primary_data.name: Nullifying Orb
primary_data.why: Sol's massive lac of mobility makes him incredibly vulnerable to jungle ganks and mage assassins like LeBlanc. Nullifying Orb helps you survive those ganks and all-ins so that you can scale into the mid game without being way behind.
primary_data.description: Gain a magic damage shield when taken to low health by magic damage.

primary_data.name: Celerity
primary_data.why: Again, mobility is the name of the game for Sol. Combined with his [E] passive Movement Speed, Celerity will grant you very reliable bonus AP.
primary_data.description: Gain 4% extra MS. Gain extra AP or AD, based on your bonus MS, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Waterwalking
primary_data.why: Waterwalking is a great rune to take on Sol when you're looking to get the early shove and roam to the side lanes for map pressure.
primary_data.description: Gain MS and AP or AD, Adaptive when in the river.

secondary_data.name: Presence of Mind
secondary_data.why: Presence of mind on Sol allows you to pick up multiple kills and assists in teamfights and keep your [W] on for extended periods of time without fear of mana constraints.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace is the go-to rune for consistent damage amp when looking to finish off targets.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Karthus.title: Rest in Peace
Karthus.description: Massive damage scaling and kill threat.

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: If you're able to slow the enemy with [W] first, your Comet is almost guaranteed to hit. Karthus is also able to quickly bring Comet back off cooldown by landing multiple [Q]s in quick succession.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: Karthus' [R] has a massive cooldown so every point of CDR is that much more valuable. At max stacks your ult will be up 24s sooner.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Absolute Focus
primary_data.why: Absolute Focus is a rune that can provide incredible amount of AP in situations where you're able to sit back and provide damage. In the case of Karthus, stay healthy in lane and look for an early cross-map [R].
primary_data.description: While above 70% health, gain up to +40 Ability Power or +28 Attack Damage (based on level), Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Gathering Storm
primary_data.why: There's not much to say here expect for 'Scaling'. Karth can be one of the hardest scaling AP Mages just by the nature of his [R]. A 40min game means you'll be hitting like a truck.
primary_data.description: Gain increasing amounts of AD or AP, Adaptive over the course of the game.

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Karth can make great use of Coup De Grace, synergizing well with both is [R] for executions, and when he's in his passive form looking to finish a target.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Presence of Mind
secondary_data.why: Karthus can actually make pretty surprisingly great use of Presence of Mind with his [E] during teamfights. Pick up kills/assists and that'll empower you to keep your [E] on for free for another 5s.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: As a champion with a very assassin heavy play style, Diana loves the burst from Electrocute. She can proc the damage pre 6 with an [E]->[W]->auto thanks to the spells not having to do damage to count toward the proc.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Post 6 Sudden impact because a vital tool in blowing up enemy champions with all-ins.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Zombie Ward
primary_data.why: Zombie Ward is an overall very reliable and good rune in all situations. It's provides a ton of vision of the course of the game and helps keep you safe early.
primary_data.description: After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: Relentless Hunter is a bit of a stylistic choice. As an assassin, Diana usually wants to type to roam a bit and find a target to explode.
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: Nullifying Orb
secondary_data.why: Nullifying Orb is almost always a good mid lane rune choice when playing against a burst mage like Syndra. Diana can sometimes struggle due to her melee nature and Null helps to keep you out of kill range.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Scorch
secondary_data.why: Scorch is a rune that heavily focuses early to mid game chip damage. If you're confident in your ability to land [Q] often is lane this can potentially put you in a great position to kill your lane opponent at 6.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Aftershock
primary_data.why: Aftershock is a great rune for entering a gank with [Q] providing you the resists to survive and a bonus burst of damage with the explosion.
primary_data.description: After immobilizing an enemy champion gain defenses and later deal a burst of adaptive damage around you.

primary_data.name: Unflinching
primary_data.why: Unflinching is a rune that synergizes well with most Junglers as smiting an enemy champion will grant you the Tenacity and Slow resist.
primary_data.description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance for each summoner spell on cooldown. Immediately after casting a Summoner Spell, gain a larger burst of Tenacity and Slow Resistance for a moderate duration.

primary_data.name: Iron Skin
primary_data.why: The flat Armor from Iron Skin pays off big in your early jungle clears, keeping you healthy for ganks. The secondary bonus also synergizes well with your itemization.
primary_data.description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.

primary_data.name: Second Wind
primary_data.why: Second Wind is a great mid fight sustain rune and the heath regenerate pair very well with Aftershock's bonus resists making you incredibly resilient early in fights.
primary_data.description: Restore health over time based on your missing health.

secondary_data.name: Gathering Storm
secondary_data.why: Gathering Storm is an overall solid rune choice on Amumu as it allows you still build full tank and rely on this as your sole source of offensive power in late games.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: Amumu's [R] is the reason why you pick him. Taking the Ultimate Hat allows you to use your ult a bit more literally in small skirmishes and still have it up for big team fights.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

Kassadin.title: Try that Again
Kassadin.description: Reliable and strong lane harass. CDR and item safety.

primary_data.name: Summon Aery
primary_data.why: Aery is a rune that is lauded for it's reliability. While less damage that Comet, it cannot miss allowing you to harass for a little bit more with [Q] in lane.
primary_data.description: Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging or shielding allies.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: Thanks to the already short cooldown on Kassadin's [R], he is able to get full Ultimate Hat stacks very quickly. This lets you take a few extra Riftwalks in the mid game for chasing kills/escaping, where you other wise not be able to.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: Kassadin is a champion who often forgoes early CDR for a stacking item like RoA and Transcendence helps patch some of that up.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch is a rune that, like Aery, is very strong and reliable during lane. These two combined make for a strong poking tool with [Q].
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
secondary_data.why: Cosmic Insight is a stable and safe rune pick for any champion in any position, especially those who take Teleport and might look to match an enemy TP right off cooldown.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Perfect Timing
secondary_data.why: The early stasis active from Perfect timing opens up opportunities for early game outplays and towers dives while also acting as a raw gold value toward a core item.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: As a pseudo AD Carry jungler, Kindred is naturally able to proc the bonus damage along side their [E] for a strong bit of burst damage.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph is the best rune in the group for Kindred as it pairs pretty nicely, when fighting to the death, with the last bit of healing from [R] topping you off to either escape of keep truckin'.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Tenacity
primary_data.why: Tenacity as a Jungler means that you're less likely to get a gank stuffed by CC when entering a lane that already had vision of you. In team fights the Tenacity simple means more uptime on damage.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Tenacity.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Kindred likes to shred her targets and kill them as fast as possible. Coup De Grace is one of the more reliable damage sources in this group.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Sudden Impact
secondary_data.why: Kindred can make good use of both the Lethality for autos and Magic Penetration for Wolf damage, when casting [Q].
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Zombie Ward
secondary_data.why: Zombie Ward is a safe a reliable rune on every Jungle thanks to the nature of their vision control and ability to deep ward.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Kayle.title: Who’s next?
Kayle.description: Last game scaling and dueling split push.

primary_data.name: Lethal Tempo
primary_data.why: As with all on-hit champions, Kayle makes great great use of the massive Attack Speed burst while her [E] is up.
primary_data.description: 1.5s after damaging a champion gain a large amount of attack speed. Lethal Tempo allows you to temporarily exceed the attack speed limit.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph is the best rune choice in this group. The healing on a kill lets you pop [R] when low and come out the other side healthy enough to keep fighting.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: More Attack Speed simple means more autos while [E] is up. Solid choice in all situations.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: End your enemies life as quickly as possible, especially squishies.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: More [R]s means more opportunities to duel and split push, especially heading into the late game when your Gathering Storm AP kicks in.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Gathering Storm
secondary_data.why: Kayle is already a champion that scales quite well into the late game. Gathering Storm propels her to a position where she is likely able to duel anyone and kill them while in [R].
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Gangplank.title: Bankplank Mid
Gangplank.description: Lane sustain, money stacking, and global pressure.

primary_data.name: Kleptomancy
primary_data.why: Gangplank is one of the biggest abusers of Kleptomancy thanks to his on-hit [Q]. Klepto will provide you with a ton of sustain/gold and occasionally more AD.
primary_data.description: Your first attack after using an ability on champions grants gold and sometimes consumables.

primary_data.name: Perfect Timing
primary_data.why: Perfect Timing is a great rune when looking to get an early/cheaper Guardian Angel.
primary_data.description: Gain a free stopwatch. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

primary_data.name: Future's Market
primary_data.description: You can enter debt to buy items.

primary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
primary_data.why: More CDR means more [Q]s which means for Klepto procs which means more gold... You get the idea.
primary_data.description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: One of GP's most underrated aspects of his kit is his global presence. A few well-placed/timed [R]s in the early game can make or break a lead. More [R]s mean more map presence.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+22 Ability Power or +13 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: There is no stat that GP likes more than CDR. His [E] heavily relies on having a lot of CDR because you're going to miss a lot of barrels.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+22 Ability Power or +13 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Locking a gold or red card with [W] effectively guarantees a hit with Comet making it one of the most reliable uses of the rune of any champion.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: TF's map pressure from his ultimate is what makes his entire kit so strong for solo queue games. Having your [R] up more often means more pressure.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Celerity
primary_data.why: Celereity grants you the movement speed needed to roam and land gold cards and while also giving you a little bit of extra AP from Ghost/Lich Bane.
primary_data.description: Gain 4% extra MS. Gain extra AP or AD, based on your bonus MS, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Gathering Storm
primary_data.why: Gathering Storm is just an all-around great rune for late-game damage insurance.
primary_data.description: Gain increasing amounts of AD or AP, Adaptive over the course of the game.

secondary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
secondary_data.why: Movement Speed is a highly prized stat for TF. It lets him get back to lane faster and pressure the map on both sides with [R].
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Zombie Ward
secondary_data.why: Zombie Ward helps keep you safe in the early to mid game proving a lot of extra value for every trinket ward you place, especially when warding the sides of mid.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Press the Attack synergizes well with BotRK and Jax's natural tendency to ramp damage in duels.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Jax is a solid tower diver and Triumph's big heal can make the difference between life and deal in sticky situations.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Tenacity
primary_data.why: Tenacity further empowers your ability to ramp your auto attacks with Press the Attack by allowing you to stick to your target.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Tenacity.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Your rune choice here largely depends on if your laning against a tank or not. Coup De Grace is good at killing squishy champions.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Unflinching
secondary_data.why: More Tenacity and slow resist means more opportunity to stick to your target, deal damage, and get the kill.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Second Wind
secondary_data.why: Second Wind is a good rune choice when looking to duel and trade as the in-combat sustain becomes incredibly useful.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Annie loves to burst and blow up her enemies. A [R]->[Q]->[W] will proc Electrocute for massive damage.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Cheap Shot
primary_data.why: Annie can reliably proc Cheap Shot thanks to her stun. Once you get *Rylai's you can continuously proc the true damage with Tibber's Aura**.
primary_data.description: Deals bonus true damage to enemies with impaired movement or actions.

primary_data.name: Zombie Ward
primary_data.why: Zombie Ward helps keep you safe in the early to mid game proving a lot of extra value for every trinket ward you place, especially in tri-brushes.
primary_data.description: After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: The bonus Movement Speed empowers you to roam around the map with your stun up for ganks and flash-engages.
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: Annie is all about blowing up the enemy team with massive Tibbers ults. More [R]s also means more opportunities to take objectives with Tibbers tanking.
secondary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: More CDR means more spell rotations. More spell rotations means more damage and kills.
secondary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

Cassiopeia.title: No Boots No Problem
Cassiopeia.description: Kiting Movement Speed and late game scaling.

primary_data.name: Phase Rush
primary_data.why: Cassiopeia massively benefits from the bonus Movement Speed on Phase Rush so she can chase down her target and continue spamming [E].
primary_data.description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 attacks or separate abilities grants a burst of MS.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Manaflow Band synergizes well with Tear allowing you to use your abilities more liberally in the early game for trades.
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Celerity
primary_data.why: Celerity double dips for Cass. She can use the Movement Speed to position for more [E]s and Phase Rush procs will grant you more AP.
primary_data.description: Gain 4% extra MS. Gain extra AP or AD, based on your bonus MS, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Gathering Storm
primary_data.why: Gathering Storm's scaling AP makes you an insane threat heading into the mid to late game.
primary_data.description: Gain increasing amounts of AD or AP, Adaptive over the course of the game.

secondary_data.name: Presence of Mind
secondary_data.why: Cassio's natural spam-heavy kit with [E] allows her you take aggressive trades when you level up and continue to sustain mana.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace lets you burn down any target and finish them off ASAP.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Corki.title: Consider Them Spanked
Corki.description: Lane safety and massive scaling damage.

primary_data.name: Fleet Footwork
primary_data.why: Fleet Footwork provides both great lane sustain as well as well as the movement speed needed to position for follow-up damage.
primary_data.description: Attacking and moving builds energy stacks. At 100 stacks, your next attack heals you and grants increased MS.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph is a great rune for champions who like to take small skirmishes. The bonus gold also helps accelerate you to a faster Tri-Force if you pick a few early game kills/assists.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Tenacity
primary_data.why: Most of your lane opponent will have forms of deadly Crowd Control. Tenacity is a huge key to successfully escaping jungle ganks.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Tenacity.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Corki can be one of the burstiest champions in the game thanks to his strong Sheen procs. Coup De Grace lets empower that burst even further on squishy targets.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Gathering Storm
secondary_data.why: Gathering Strom's late game scaling AD makes you an insanely scary threat in the mid to late game.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Nullifying Orb
secondary_data.why: Nullifying Orb acts very similarly to a Hex Drinker shield allowing you to take some aggressive trades with burst mages with relative safety.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Press the Attack's exposure damage synergizes incredibly well with BotRK + Black Cleaver + [R] shredding even the tankiest champions.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Overheal
primary_data.why: Overheal is a great rune for topping off your heal to sustain chip damage from the enemy, and synergizes well with the Life Steal from BotRK and Bloodline.

primary_data.name: Legend: Bloodline
primary_data.why: More Life Steal means longer trades equalling Lucian gets off more Passive procs and Press the Attack damage.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Lifesteal.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Coup De Grace is a great rune for finishing of the last bit of health on champions you have shredded with Black Cleaver and Press the Attack.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Sudden Impact
secondary_data.why: Sudden Impact on Lucian provides a solid amount of Lethality when casting [E] allowing you to keep the buff up reliably if you're rotating your spells well.

Sivir.title: Life’s Cheap, Death Pays

Taliyah.title: Those in Glass Houses
Taliyah.description: Well-rounded lane presence and late-game scaling.

primary_data.why: [Q] spam on Taliyah allows her to repeatedly proc Comet and reduce it's cooldown quickly.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.
