primary_data.name: Cut Down
primary_data.why: Cut Down is the ultimate go-to for shredding big beefy tanks with a ton of health.
primary_data.description: Deal more damage to champion with more maximum health than you.

secondary_data.name: Iron Skin
secondary_data.why: Iron Skin is a great early-game option for trading in lane and winning fights against heavy AD comps.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Revitalize
secondary_data.why: Revitalize is a great laning rune when you're looking to trade often and come out healthy, winning the attrition war.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Ezreal makes great use of Press the Attack as he can easily proc it with an Auto->[Q]->Auto. This quick proc makes all following [Q]s and BotRK attacks incredibly powerful at killing any target.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Overheal
primary_data.why: Overheal is a great rune for keeping yourself healthy going into a trade and synergizes well with Legend: Bloodline and BotRK's Life Steal.
primary_data.description: Excess healing on you becomes a shield.

primary_data.name: Legend: Bloodline
primary_data.why: Ezreal has always made great use of Life Steal thanks to the high base-damage on [Q]. Bloodline here should help you continue to sustain through the early-game as well. Heading into the mid-game your damage+healing should allow you to duel just about anyone.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Lifesteal.

primary_data.name: Last Stand
primary_data.why: Last Stand is a great rune choice when you find yourself fighting a target that is chasing you down.
primary_data.description: Deal more damage to champions while you are low on health.

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Ezreal probably loves CDR more than any other AD Carry does. CDR means more survivability and way more damage. Transcendence let's you easily hit 40% CDR with Tri-Force + Lucidity Boots.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Gathering Storm
secondary_data.why: This loadout is all about pumping out as much damage as possible and there is no rune that does this better than the scaling nature of Gathering Storm. Ez doesn't usually build a lot of raw AD so Storm does a great job of making up for that in long games.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Ezreal.title: Money in the Bank
Ezreal.description: Money-making, weak early, and accelerated item scaling.

primary_data.name: Kleptomancy
primary_data.why: Kleptomancy procs exactly like Sheen resulting in Ezreal being one of the biggest abusers of the proc though the use of [Q].
primary_data.description: Your first attack after using an ability on champions grants gold and sometimes consumables.

primary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
primary_data.why: Klepto potions plus Biscuits means you shouldn't have to purchase many potions at all with earned gold, letting you bypass the Lending fee of Future's Market and hit item power-spikes insanely early.
primary_data.description: Get a free biscuit every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes. Biscuits heal and permanently increase your max mana.

primary_data.name: Future's Market
primary_data.description: You can enter debt to buy items.

primary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
primary_data.why: Ezreal probably loves CDR more than any other AD Carry does. CDR means more survivability and way more damage. The slight Summoner cooldown also provides safety in your weak early game.
primary_data.description:
+5% CDR
+5% Max CDR
+5% Summoner Spell CDR
+5% Item CDR

secondary_data.name: Triumph
secondary_data.why: Triumph allows you to stick to the edges of teamfights to pick off kills and assists, even when low health and continue on fighting. In early lane fights the heal can be the difference between a double kill and losing lane.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+20% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Coup De Grace allows you to snipe and pick off low health targets with the massive damage of your [Q].
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+20% Attack Speed

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Thanks to his passive, Bard is able to easily proc electrocute for huge burst with either Auto->[Q] or Auto->Auto.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Cheap Shot
primary_data.why: Once you've collected 5 chimes Bard's passive auto attacks slow, proccing Cheap Shot. Paired with Bard's [Q] you'll be permanently slowing and dealing True Damage to any target you wish.
primary_data.description: Deals bonus true damage to enemies with impaired movement or actions.

primary_data.name: Zombie Ward
primary_data.why: Zombie Ward is a great rune choice in this slot as it synergizes well with Sightstone and Bard's natural roaming nature, allowing him to get deeper wards more often.
primary_data.description: After killing an enemy ward, a friendly Zombie Ward is raised in its place.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: Relentless Hunter further empowers Bard's ability to roam the map, collect chimes, and get to any fight.
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: Scorch
secondary_data.why: Scorch on Bard empowers your early laning phase trades to do big damage with kill potential with sustained harass damage.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Manaflow Band
secondary_data.why: Bard can often run low on mana in lane if you're taking a lot of trades due to a high mana cost on [W]. If you cast [W] when Manaflow Band is available you'll sustain quite well allowing for more aggressive trades.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Taric.title: Truly Outrageous
Taric.description: Powerful Heals, Shields, and Active Items.

primary_data.name: Guardian
primary_data.why: Guardian synergizes well with Taric's [W] when looking to block big incoming damage.
primary_data.description: Guard allies you cast spells on and those that are very nearby. If you or a guarded ally would take damage, you're both hasted and granted a shield.

primary_data.name: Font of Life
primary_data.why: Taric loves to build Increased Healing/Shielding items so proccing Font of Life with [E] will result is a lot of healing for your teammates when you they hit the enemy champions.
primary_data.description: Cooldown: 45s

primary_data.name: Iron Skin
primary_data.why: Iron Skin grants Armor to allow healthy trading in lane as well as great synergy with [W]. If youre playing into a passive lane (like Janna) you can be greedy and opt for less lane power and strong mid-game with Conditioning.
primary_data.description: Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them. Your allies heal when attacking champion's you've marked.

primary_data.name: Revitalize
primary_data.why: Revitalize synergizes well with both [Q] healing strength and Locket shielding. If you're expecting to take a lot of poke in lane, Second Wind is a good option for sustain.
primary_data.description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.

secondary_data.name: Ingenious Hunter
secondary_data.why: A large portion of a support's power comes from item actives and Ingenious Hunter helps to make sure you have Locket and Redemption up as often as possible, granting 40% item/trinket CDR at max stacks.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Zombie Ward
secondary_data.why: Zombie ward is a great rune choice on any support as it scales your vision score incredibly well along side Sightstone.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: A successful Morgana [Q] results in a guaranteed landed Comet and a significant amount of damage.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: Manaflow Band
primary_data.why: Manaflow Band is a great rune choice is this slot for Mage supports because to provides a significant amount of mana sustain for lane harass and skirmishes. If the enemy team has multiple AP threats you can take Nullifying Orb.
primary_data.description: Periodically your next ability used has its mana or energy cost refunded and restores some of your missing mana or energy.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: Supports build a lot of CDR items thanks to the raw utility of their kits. More CDR = more power and with Transcendence you have no fear of over-capping. Celerity is a great secondary option for roams and picks.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: If you choose to put a point in [W] early Scorch becomes incredibly easy to proc on cooldown for lane harass.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Perfect Timing
secondary_data.why: A free early Statis is a god-send for Morgana to land a huge [R]. The free Stopwatch also means that Zhonya's is that much closer to completion.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Cosmic Insight
secondary_data.why: Doubling down on CDR and a little extra summoner cooldown for Flash->[R] is great here for Morg. Magical Footwear is also a great option here if you're looking to save money and hit combat stat power-spikes sooner.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Nasus.title: Breach the Gates
Nasus.description: Split push, scaling, and opening the gates.

primary_data.name: Phase Rush
primary_data.why: Non-damaging spells count toward proccing Phase rush so a simple [W]->[E]->Auto will let you hunt down your target and resist slows.
primary_data.description: Hitting an enemy champion with 3 attacks or separate abilities grants a burst of MS.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: More [R]s means more reliable damage on command, and more surviveability.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: More stacks ASAP. Nasus loves every CDR defensive item and with transcendence you don't have to worry about over-capping.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Gathering Storm
primary_data.why: Usually when playing Nasus you're looking to come online in the mid to late game. Gathering Storm scales incredibly well along side you while you stack away.
primary_data.description: Gain increasing amounts of AD or AP, Adaptive over the course of the game.

secondary_data.name: Demolish
secondary_data.why: Nasus is all about opening the gates. Demolish + [Q] means you're shredding towers in no-time.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Second Wind
secondary_data.why: Second Wind is a great sustain rune when playing into difficult match-ups. Like Doran's Shield, it allows you to mitigate a lot of the chip damage you might take.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Summon Aery
primary_data.why: Like an Enchanter support, Ivern's power revolves largely around his [E] shield and Summon Aery empowers those shields to be even stronger.
primary_data.description: Your attacks and abilities send Aery to a target, damaging or shielding allies.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: The Ultimate hat here on Ivern allows you to have Daisey more often for tower dives and skirmishes.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: CDR is vital to Ivern's strength in fights. Post 10mins. you should be able to get off several more shield with [E] in every skirmish.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch provides an considerable bit of damage in early skirmishes.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Revitalize
secondary_data.why: Ritalize synergizes well with Ivern, empowering both his [E] as well as item build (Locket, Redemption, Athene's, etc.).
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Conditioning
secondary_data.why: Conditioning on Ivern provides him with solid all-around resistances to take skirmishes over objectives in any lane.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Aftershock
primary_data.why: Rammus is all about engaging with the CC of his [Q] and [E] and the taunt should last long enough to keep your target in the explosion radius.
primary_data.description: After immobilizing an enemy champion gain defenses and later deal a burst of adaptive damage around you.

primary_data.name: Unflinching
primary_data.why: Rammus' biggest counters are CC and slows applied to him while rolling in. Unflinching allows you sure up some of those weaknesses.
primary_data.description: Increase your Tenacity and Slow Resistance for each summoner spell on cooldown. Immediately after casting a Summoner Spell, gain a larger burst of Tenacity and Slow Resistance for a moderate duration.

primary_data.name: Conditioning
primary_data.why: Rammus benefits massively from both Armor and Magic resist, scaling his [W] to make him an unkillable machine.
primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

primary_data.name: Overgrowth
primary_data.why: Health is especially strong on Rammus as it scales multiplicatively with resists, which he gets a ton of from his [W].
primary_data.description: Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

secondary_data.name: Cheap Shot
secondary_data.why: Rammus' ability to repeatedly Slow/CC enemy champions with [Q], [E], and [R] allows him to proc bonus Cheap Shot True Damage in nearly every skirmish several times, granting you the extra bit of damage for any kill.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
secondary_data.why: Relentless Hunter's stacking Movement Speed combined with your [Q] allows you to get to any fight or skirmish on the map at the drop of a hat.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Evelynn is able to easily proc Electrocute when coming out of stealth with a [W]->[Q]->[Q] combo for an extra burst of damage to finish her target.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Exiting Stealth grants the Sudden Impact bonus Magic Penetration that Eve can use to assassinate the enemy champion.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Eyeball Collection
primary_data.why: Clearing wards is a key part of a jungler's position. Pair that with assassination potential and you'll be racking of plenty of bonus Ability Power to snowball the game.
primary_data.description: Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain permanent AD or AP, Adaptive for each eyeball plus bonus upon collection completion.

primary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
primary_data.why: Movement Speed is a key aspect to getting around the map to meet and initiate fights.
primary_data.description: Unique champion takedowns grant permanent out of combat MS.

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: Evelynn's [R] offers massive offensive power with it high base execution damage, and great defensive utility with it's ability to quickly blink you over a wall to get away.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Celerity
secondary_data.why: The bonus Movement Speed from Celerity allows you to more quickly and effectively clear the jungle so you can properly position for ganks.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Aftershock
primary_data.why: Rakan excels at engaging and CCing the enemy team, but he naturally needs help survive the engage. The resists provided by Aftershock let you get in and get out.
primary_data.description: After immobilizing an enemy champion gain defenses and later deal a burst of adaptive damage around you.

primary_data.name: Font of Life
primary_data.why: Rakan naturally itemizes to empower his heals and shields and thanks to his AoE CC he is able to proc Font of Life on multiple targets and provide even more healing.
primary_data.description: Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them. Your allies heal when attacking champion's you've marked.

primary_data.name: Conditioning
primary_data.why: Condition is a great all-around defensive rune that synergizes with Aftershock to help you survive engages that you otherwise shouldn't'.
primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

primary_data.name: Revitalize
primary_data.why: Revitalize is great at empowering Rakan's heals from items, Font of Life, and [Q] as well as his passive and [E] shielding.
primary_data.description: Heals and shields are 5% stronger and increased by an additional 10% on targets below 40% health.

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Rakan naturally has long cooldowns on his abilities because they are naturally so powerful. The more CDR you're able to stack the more utility you provide.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: The Ultimate Hat doubles down on Rakan's signature of engaging teamfights with his ult. More ults = more teamfight wins.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

Gnar.title: Where Do You Think You’re going?
Gnar.description: Lane dominance, chase, and kill potential.

primary_data.name: Glacial Augment
primary_data.why: Gnar loves to build Frozen Mallet and this rune allows you to bypass the item while still getting the same benefits. Hit an auto-attack and chase down your enemy proccing as many [W]'s as possible.
primary_data.description: Your first attack against an enemy champion slows them (per unit cooldown). Slowing champions with active items shoots a freeze ray at them, creating a lingering slow zone.

primary_data.name: Perfect Timing
primary_data.why: Perfect Timing serves double duty in both providing a clutch 1-time Zhonya's active as well as saving you gold on purchasing Gargoyle's Stoneplate.
primary_data.description: Gain a free stopwatch. Stopwatch has a one time use Stasis active.

primary_data.name: Future's Market
primary_data.description: You can enter debt to buy items.

primary_data.name: Approach Velocity
primary_data.why: Approach Velocity is actually a very valuable and abusable rune when paired with Glacial Augment. Glacial's slow paired with Approach's Movement Speed will let you hit land more auto attacks than otherwise possible
primary_data.description: Bonus MS towards nearby allies that are movement impaired or enemies that you impair movement on.

secondary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
secondary_data.why: Gnar loves a lot of attack speed to abuse his range and proc his [W] as often as possible in melee matchups. With Glacial Augment these rune becomes even more powerful.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+20% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Coup De Grace
secondary_data.why: Between Press the Attack and repeated procs of Gnar's [W] you should be able to quickly whittle the enemy champion to 40% health and get the bonus damage to kill them.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+20% Attack Speed

primary_data.name: Press the Attack
primary_data.why: Gnar's biggest Top Lane strength is abusing melee champions with his range. Press the Attack's exposed bonus damage makes Gnar's [W] an incredible threat.
primary_data.description: Attacking a champion 3 times will expose them, dealing bonus damage and causing them to take more damage from all sources for 6 seconds.

primary_data.name: Triumph
primary_data.why: Triumph means more health and gold on kills and because you're looking to duel, kill, and escape safely this is the best option in this row.
primary_data.description: Takedowns restore health and grant bonus gold.

primary_data.name: Legend: Alacrity
primary_data.why: Gnar loves a lot of attack speed to abuse his range and proc his [W] as often as possible in melee matchups.
primary_data.description: Takedowns on enemies grant permanent Attack Speed.

primary_data.name: Coup De Grace
primary_data.why: Between Press the Attack and repeated procs of Gnar's [W] you should be able to quickly whittle the enemy champion to 40% health and get the bonus damage to kill them.
primary_data.description: Deal 5% more damage to low health champions. Gain AD/AP after kills or assists.

secondary_data.name: Demolish
secondary_data.why: Gnar shines when he's able to pressure his lane, split push, and take towers. Demolish is key in taking those towers and scales well with Gnar's natural health stacking.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

secondary_data.name: Conditioning
secondary_data.why: Conditioning is a great all-around defensive rune choice. If you're looking for more lane pressure feel free to take Iron Skin or Mirror Shell depending on the matchup.
secondary_data.description: +18% Attack Speed

Shen.title: From the Shadows
Shen.description: Split push and map pressure with ult.

primary_data.name: Grasp of the Undying
primary_data.why: Shen naturally takes great advantage of Grasp's empowered auto-attacks thanks to the majority of his power being in his [Q].
primary_data.description: Every 4s your next attack on a champion deals bonus damage, heals you, and permanently increases your health.

primary_data.name: Demolish
primary_data.why: This loadout focuses on split push pressure thanks to a lower cooldown [R]. Demolish excels in situations where you're able to split and take towers.
primary_data.description: Charge up a powerful attack against a tower while near it.

primary_data.name: Conditioning
primary_data.why: Conditioning is an all-around solid defensive rune, giving up early weak resists for stronger resists later. These resists also scale well with Shen's natural health stacking.
primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

primary_data.name: Overgrowth
primary_data.why: Shen loves to stack health as it improves his passive shield and tankiness. Overgrowth scales incredibly well with high-health items and champions.
primary_data.description: Every 8 monsters or enemy minions that die near you permanently increases your max health by 0.2%.

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Transcendence + The Ultimate hat will go a long way in getting you to CDR cap and above so you're able to continue splitting an enter any fight with [R].
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
secondary_data.why: Shen's [R] has a naturally long cooldown so every percentage of CDR from The Ultimate hat has even more value.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

Singed.title: How About a Drink?
Singed.description: Split-push, lane sustain, and summoner spell spam.

primary_data.name: Unsealed Spellbook
primary_data.why: Singed's unique play-style allows him to excel in situations where he is able to cheese and split-push. Spellbook allows him to not only cheese for a kill by taking ignite, but also gives him the freedom to use his Summoner Spells more liberally thanks to the bonus Summoner CDR.
primary_data.description: Get Summoner Shards and exchange them at the shop to change your Summoner Spells during game.

primary_data.name: Biscuit Delivery
primary_data.why: Biscuit Delivery not only grants a massive amount Health regeneration but mana as well. Combined with the Inspiration's +20% potion bonus and Dark Seal, you can easily double the strength of all potions and Biscuits.
primary_data.description: Get a free biscuit every 3 minutes, until 12 minutes. Biscuits heal and permanently increase your max mana.

primary_data.name: Magical Footwear
primary_data.why: Singed likes to run, and if you're able to effectively make it to the 10min mark without boots you'll be running even faster with the enhanced boots.
primary_data.description: You get free boots at 10 min. but you cannot buy boots before then. These boots give additional MS. For each takedown you acquire the boots 30s sooner.

primary_data.name: Celestial Body
primary_data.why: Celestial Body allows singed to endure a bit of harassment in the early-game so that he can get to the point of unstoppable split-pushing.
primary_data.description: +100 permanent health at the cost of early champion damage.

secondary_data.name: Unflinching
secondary_data.why: Unflinching synergizes incredibly well with both Spellbook's play-style of active Summoner use and granting Singed a large amount of Tenacity/Slow Resistance, his biggest counters.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+145 Health

secondary_data.name: Iron Skin
secondary_data.why: Iron Skin allows you to take a small amount of less damage from minions while proxying. You're also able to easily proc the bonus Armor effect thanks to Biscuits and Refillable.
secondary_data.description:
+20% Potion and Elixir Duration
+145 Health

Braum.title: Unbreakable Freljord Heart
Braum.description: Shields, heals, and all about the tankiness.

primary_data.name: Guardian
primary_data.why: Braum naturally spends a lot of time near his teammates thanks to his [W] and [E]. The shield Provided by Guardian allows you and your AD Carry to absorb a bit of damage before you start blocking with [E].
primary_data.description: Guard allies you cast spells on and those that are very nearby. If you or a guarded ally would take damage, you're both hasted and granted a shield.

primary_data.name: Font of Life
primary_data.why: Between his Passive, [Q], and [R] Braum has a number of means of marking enemies for healing with Font of Life.
primary_data.description: Cooldown: 45s

primary_data.name: Iron Skin
primary_data.why: Braum spends a lot of time and health blocking auto attacks with [E] resulting in him taking a majority of Physical damage. Iron Skin allows you to come out the other end of that healthy.
primary_data.description: Impairing the movement of an enemy champion marks them. Your allies heal when attacking champion's you've marked.

primary_data.name: Second Wind
primary_data.why: Second Wind's massive mid-fight health sustain allows you to absorb the brunt of your team's incoming damage when your [E] is up and come out the other side healthy enough to keep fighting.
primary_data.description: Gain 5 Armor. Whenever you heal for at least 20 health or from a consumable's effect, increase your Armor by 5% for 3 seconds.

secondary_data.name: Celestial Body
secondary_data.why: The massive bonus health from Celestial Body contributes to the healing and shielding on Font of Life and Guardian.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Magical Footwear
secondary_data.why: Magical Footwear is an interesting rune choice in that it can often be seen as a raw value of 350g allowing you to invest that into other items.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

Leona.title: Try to Leave a Dent
Leona.description: Lane dominance kill threat and map roaming

primary_data.name: Aftershock
primary_data.why: Leona's all-in style of gameplay heavily revolves around jumping on your target and killing them as fast as possible. Aftershock's explosion damage further pushes your ability to kill the enemy after CCing them.
primary_data.description: After immobilizing an enemy champion gain defenses and later deal a burst of adaptive damage around you.

primary_data.name: Demolish
primary_data.why: Engage your target, kill, and punish them by dealing massive amounts of damage to the tower while they respawn.
primary_data.description: Charge up a powerful attack against a tower while near it.

primary_data.name: Conditioning
primary_data.why: Conditioning on Leona is great once you've hit the 10min mark as both the bonus Armor and MR contribute to your [W] strength.
primary_data.description: After 10 minutes gain 8 Armor and 8 Magic Resist and increase your total Armor and Magic Resist by 5%.

primary_data.name: Second Wind
primary_data.why: After engaging, Second Wind allows you to regenerate health mid-fight and chase down your target.
primary_data.description: Restore health over time based on your missing health.

secondary_data.name: Cheap Shot
secondary_data.why: Leona's all-in and CC heavy play-style makes Cheap Shot a great option for that extra bit of damage when looking to make a pick and kill your target as quickly as possible.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

secondary_data.name: Relentless Hunter
secondary_data.why: Relentless Hunter's extra bit of out of combat Movement Speed empowers your ability as Leona to roam the map and easily get into range to land your [E] and make picks.
secondary_data.description: +130 Health

Alistar.title: Can’t Milk Those
Alistar.description: Engage and teamfight power with item actives.

primary_data.name: Aftershock
primary_data.why: Aftershock, like Courage of the Colossus, is a great keystone choice for Alister as it gives you defenses upon engaging and a bit of extra damage thanks to the explosion.
primary_data.description: After immobilizing an enemy champion gain defenses and later deal a burst of adaptive damage around you.

primary_data.name: Font of Life

secondary_data.description: +130 Health

Darius.title: Bring down the Guillotine

primary_data.description: Deals bonus true damage to enemies with impaired movement or actions.

primary_data.name: Ravenous Hunter

primary_data.description: Heal for a percentage of damage dealt with your abilities. Increases with each unique takedown.

secondary_data.name: Revitalize

secondary_data.name: Conditioning
secondary_data.why: Like a typical Juggernaut you're incredible immobile so resistances pay off huge when chasing your target down. Feel free to take Iron Skin or Mirror shell based on the enemy team comp.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

Ahri.title: The Poking Fox
Ahri.description: Consistent lane pressure and item efficiency.

primary_data.name: Arcane Comet
primary_data.why: Arcane Comet has a low cooldown allowing Ahri to proc it repetitively in lane for harassment damage.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with spells hurls a comet that deals adaptive damage at them. Landing more spells reduces Arcane Comet's cooldown.

primary_data.name: The Ultimate Hat
primary_data.why: Ahri's ultimate grants her incredible kill potential and lane safety. Having it off cooldown as often as possible is fantastic for her.
primary_data.description: Gain cooldown reduction and max cooldown reduction on your ultimate. This is increased further each time you use your ultimate, up to a maximum.

primary_data.name: Transcendence
primary_data.why: Transcendence is a great rune choice for most mages as repetitive spell casts is the majority of their damage, and pairs well with Ultimate Hat.
primary_data.description: Gain 10% CDR when you reach level 10. Excess CDR becomes AP or AD, Adaptive.

primary_data.name: Scorch
primary_data.why: Scorch is a rune that is incredibly reliable and provides the damage needed to eek out lane dominance.
primary_data.description: Your first ability hit every 20s burns champions.

secondary_data.name: Perfect Timing
secondary_data.why: Perfect timing is a great option on Ahri who often wants Zhonyas as she tends to dive in for her damage. It also secondarily acts as a pure gold, saving you the cost of an item component.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Magical Footwear
secondary_data.why: Magical footwear is a great choice on any champion loadout as it can be seen as simple earning 350g at level 10, which is always good. Ahri can also make great use of the bonus movespeed.
secondary_data.description: +20 Ability Power or +12 Attack Damage, Adaptive

primary_data.name: Electrocute
primary_data.why: Ahri is able to quickly and easily activate Electrocute with her skillset for an extra bit of damage and kill potential.
primary_data.description: Hitting a champion with 3 separate attacks or abilities in 2s deals bonus adaptive damage.

primary_data.name: Sudden Impact
primary_data.why: Once 6, Ahri's [R] paired with Sudden Impact offers incredible kill potential against any lane opponent.
primary_data.description: Gain a burst of Lethality and Magic Penetration after using a dash, leap, blink, teleport, or on leaving stealth.

primary_data.name: Eyeball Collection
primary_data.why: Eyeball Collection pairs nicely with Electrocute and Sudden Impact to further push Ahri into a carry role.
primary_data.description: Collect eyeballs for champion and ward takedowns. Gain permanent AD or AP, Adaptive for each eyeball plus bonus upon collection completion.

primary_data.name: Ravenous Hunter
primary_data.why: The Spell Vamp from Ravenous Hunter gives Ahri the healing necessary in fights for multiple spell rotations.
primary_data.description: Heal for a percentage of damage dealt with your abilities. Increases with each unique takedown.

secondary_data.name: Scorch
secondary_data.why: Scorch in an incredibly reliable source of early-game extra damage and Ahri is easily able to proc it on cooldown.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive

secondary_data.name: Transcendence
secondary_data.why: Like most Mid Laners cooldown reduction is a huge source of power. More Spell rotations means more damage and more healing from Ahri's passive and Ravenous Hunter.
secondary_data.description: +18 Ability Power or +11 Attack Damage, Adaptive
